She is surrounded by an amazing staff who are doing everything they can to stabilize her condition. Unfortunately  she does not have health insurance and all of her medical treatment is going to be very expensive. The goal is for her to be stable enough to be returned to her home in Goodyear  AZ. Graciela is a family oriented person of great faith. She is a strong woman and is doing everything she can to fight on. We have faith in God that she will recover from this and that she will once again be the loving  caring  and hard-working woman that we know her to be. The road to recovery will be a long one filled with days of great progress and nerve-wracking setbacks. Anything you can provide to her and her family during this difficult time would be greatly appreciated. Please keep her in your thoughts and prayers. Thank you for all of your support and for taking the time to share and/or donate to this cause. God bless you and your loved ones - Pedroza Family Nuestra madre  Graciela Pedroza  sufrió una embolia cerebral severa el viernes  19 de octubre  mientras regresaba a casa de México. Ella estaba en Zacatecas por los servicios funerarios de su suegro y estaba en la carretera cuando ocurrió. Ella fue apresurada a una clínica Mexicana en Juárez  desafortunadamente ella no recibió la atención apropiada y su cerebro sufrió daño severo. Afortunadamente  fue llevada al centro médico de la Universidad en El Paso  Texas  donde actualmente está recibiendo atención médica. Ella está rodeada por un personal médico increíble que están haciendo todo lo posible para estabilizar su condición. Desafortunadamente  ella no tiene seguro médico y todo su tratamiento médico va a ser muy costoso. El objetivo es que ella sea lo suficientemente estable como para ser devuelta a su casa en Goodyear  AZ. Graciela es una persona orientada a la familia y de gran fe. Ella es una mujer fuerte y está haciendo todo lo posible para luchar y recuperarse. Tenemos fe en Dios que ella se recuperará de esto y que una vez más será la mujer amorosa  cariñosa y trabajadora que sabemos que es. El camino a la recuperación será largo y lleno de días de gran progreso y de reveses estresantes. Todo lo que pueda proporcionarle a ella y a su familia durante este difícil momento sería muy apreciado. Por favor  manténgala en sus pensamientos y oraciones. Gracias por todo su apoyo y por tomarse el tiempo para compartir y/o donar a esta causa. Dios los bendiga a ustedes y a sus seres queridos- Familia Pedroza

storyTitle: Support Maria Battleing Kidney Disease Stage 5
story: Dear  Family  Friends and Friends of Friends As some of you may already know My Mother has been battleing with Kidney Disease for 2 years and unfortunately She has reach Stage 5 Kidney Failure.We are at a point where the hospital has started her on dialysis.We are having issues because She doesn’t apply for health insurance while we figure out the insurance situation we have cover the full cost of dialysis treatment.My mom Maria has always been a happy friendly loving and caring person She is an amazing Mother and  Grandmother She has always been willing and happy to help others.But now She needs our love and support more than ever. During this tough time We will appreciate any support we can get Dialysis is very crucial for her so Please keep her in your prayers.Querida  Familia  Amigos y Amigos de Amigos.Como ya muchos de ustedes saben Mi Madre Maria Garcia a estado luchando por 2 años con problemas de Insuficiencia Renal desafortunadamente ella a llegado a etapa 5 de su enfermedad de Riñon.Estamos en el punto que el hospital la a comenzado en diálisis.Estamos teniendo problemas porque no tiene cobertura médica que se haga cargo de los gastos de diálisis.Mi Madre Maria siempre a sido una persona alegre  amigable  amorosa y llena de vida dispuesta ayudar a otros pero ahora ella necesita nuestro amor y apoyo más que nunca.Durante estos momentos difíciles agradeceríamos mucho su apoyo y cualquier ayuda que nos pudieran proporcionar.Es muy importante que ella reciba el tratamiento para mejorar su condición de Salud.Pedimos Oración por ella y su recuperación.De ante mano agradecemos su ayuda

UPDATE:Wed. 11/07Hi friends and family  I'm out of surgery. I'm on drugs. I am woozy but OK. The nurses and staff here have been very lovely. I have this GoFundMe Campaign to help me cover these extremely high costs. I'm trying to raise $5K for my surgery bills  copays  physical therapy costs  and my unpaid time off work while I recover. If any of you are able to help me out I would be forever in gratitude. Thank you so much! Lots of lovexxJustin-------------Hello Friends It's a bit embarrassing and humbling to ask you all for help  thanks for reading my story. I need to get surgery on my left knee and I'm hoping for some assistance as I get this procedure done and recover.Many of you know me from my involvement in  music. I've been a touring musician since I was 15 years old. I have had the fortunate pleasure of recording and touring with acclaimed underdogs Clorox Girls  Red Dons  LA Drugz  Maniac  and Suspect Parts.As music doesn't pay the bills  I have worked dozens of jobs over the years  and recently became a full-time freelance American Sign Language interpreter. My mom  stepdad  and aunt are deaf  so I grew up immersed in Deaf culture and was able to sign before I could talk. After years of low-paying and soul destroying jobs (including a few excruciating years as a dental supply salesman)  I realized that I could have a rewarding profession working with the Deaf community.  It's going great so far  but as I'm freelance  my income isn't always stable and sometimes it can be difficult as most freelance agencies pay monthly on varying schedules. ASL Interpreting can be a potentially lucrative and fulfilling profession  but in this case I may need a bit of a running start.  So far so good though  some recent highlights include a couple of TV appearances on Jimmy Kimmel and Entertainment Tonight. To keep in shape  I play full court basketball with a group of writers  actors  comedians and a couple of semi-retired comedy writers who wrote for shows like Sanford and Son  Punky Brewster  Seinfeld  and Sister Sister.  One day I tore the meniscus in my left knee in two places and badly bruised my ACL.  At first I could barely walk  and while it did somewhat heal  the docs told me that I need surgery on my left knee or I'm at risk of constant inflammation and pain for the rest of my life. Right now I have discomfort and pain in my knee when climbing stairs  hills  long walks  or any kind of heavy lifting or prolonged physical activity. The docs have scheduled me for a meniscus repair surgery at 7am on Nov 7th 2018.I hope to one day be able to enjoy the physical activities I love again  including long walks  hikes  yoga  full court basketball  and of course a few high kicks onstage with my punk rock bands. I think I can get there with some surgery  physical therapy  and a little help from my friends.It's admittedly embarrassing and humbling to ask for help. I do have health insurance  and they will pay for 80% of my surgery  but I will have to pay about $3000 out of pocket  and I won't be able to work for 2-4 weeks. There will also be co-pays and additional cost for post-surgery physical therapy sessions.  As I'm 100% freelance  unpaid time off work will be very difficult financially. Right now its impossible for me to cover the surgery  related costs  and loss of income on my own. I'm hoping to raise $5K so that I can afford my surgery/medical bills  be prepared for physical therapy costs  and to help cover my bills for the 2-4 weeks I'm unable to work. For some people that might not be a lot of money  but to me it is huge and will help me bounce back. Really appreciate it everyone! Thank you very much for your help.  Lots of love.Your friend Justin Maurer www.justin-maurer.com

It was really a blow to find out a few months ago that for the third time in 7 years  I would have to undergo brain surgery – this time the result of a second serious infection. The first surgery  in 2012  was to remove a large brain tumor (thankfully noncancerous). It was removed successfully  but complications required several months of difficult rehab. Then everything was fine until 2016  when I contracted an infection that went straight to my skull bones  some of which had to be removed and replaced with a metal mesh plate. This Thanksgiving  the metal plate itself became infected and had to be removed. In a second operation  a plastic surgeon covered the area temporarily with a “free flap” made from a skin graft. In 3-6 months  when there is no risk of further infection and the flap is completely healed  I will get a 3-d printed plastic skull plate in one last operation. I don’t really mind losing what little hair I have left (I like colorful scarves)  or even having to wear a silly helmet for several months (I’ve done it before!). But being out of commission for months each time means that it takes that much longer to get back up to speed with life and especially work – and that’s what really worries me. Each time  my life gets put on hold. It’s scary. I have lots of really wonderful  supportive friends  whom I’m tremendously grateful for  but I don’t have a spouse or partner to help with the bills  so I’m on my own. Since I work by the hour  when I’m not working  I’m not earning a living. I am an artist and art teacher  and I love what I do. I work part time for ACE – Adult and Community Enrichment at Suncoast Technical College. I went though my meager savings during the two previous episodes in 2012 and 2016  and have not been able to replenish that “rainy day fund.” I’m trying to figure out what I can do to generate additional income with artwork or something else to give me a buffer against future downtime  but in the meantime  I have to get past this current bump in the road. That’s why I started this GoFundMe page. My small Social Security check will take care of a few vital bills such as my health insurance premium and utilities  but in a couple of weeks I’ll be pretty much out of money until mid-March when a little teaching income comes in again from the classes that start in February. I expect to need about $2000 to help cover the mortgage and expenses for two months until I’m up to speed again. I’m working hard in physical therapy to build my strength and stamina so that I can go back to my job with full strength. If you'd like to see more of my artwork  my website is  www.PatriciaRockwood.com.I will be forever grateful for any amount that you can contribute. Thank you so much.Patricia Rockwood

storyTitle: Please Help My Dad Battle Stage 4 Breast Cancer
story: I know we have not mentioned because we all have been trying to stay strong during this Holiday season  but My Father Mark Pederson was diagnosed with stage 4 Breast Cancer which has spread to his lungs  lymph nodes and spine. I do not know if you have experienced cancer within your family or close loved ones  but it is not the most exciting news especially when it is your Father/Best Friend. Watching someone you use to go jog and exercise with to not being able to walk across a room or do the simple things like get ready or shower at home without stopping to catch their breath from lack of oxygen in lungs is horrific and devastating. I love my father and as much as I can do anything for him physically him not being able to DJ/work full time and having no health insurance has taken a toll on his income and living situation is very hard and rough right now. My family and I are praying and hoping that God restore his health and get this process going so that it takes less stress off of him financially and physically. My family and I please ask if you can pray for his health and finances and to donate anything at all to help him in his time of need that you pray hard about it and if you can help us support him financially during this hard time for us all then please do so. I and my Father have been hard on myself to ask for help during this time as I and my Father never want to ask for help  but the amount of finances he has taken on just my Family and I just can't endure alone. We Love him very much and want to help him so please if you can find it in your hearts to give a little for my Father we ask that you please donate and also pray for his health and recovery. The Pederson Family wishes you a Very Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your support and prayers.God Bless!

Karen Armstrong  is the caregiver  supporter  and cheerleader for so many others.  A through and through special educator  she has devoted her career to helping others achieve to their potential and obtain the resources needed to do so.   Karen is a loving and devoted wife and mother  as anyone who has spent any time with Karen would know  always putting the needs of her family first. Karen is the type of person who you can count on to lift you up when you're down  and never expects anything in return.6-months ago  Karen was diagnosed with breast cancer. She went through her initial diagnosis and surgery with a positive and courageous mindset  and returned to her caregiver role at work and in her personal life soon after the first phase of treatment (despite her family and friends and colleagues concern).  The second phase of treatment approaching  Karen's health insurance provider declined her oncologist's request for Proton Beam Therapy as an alternative to radiation and chemotherapy.  The short and long term health effects differ significantly between the two types of treatment.   Despite Karen's oncology team at Loma Linda University Hospital recommending her as an ideal candidate for Proton Beam Therapy to eradicate the cancer from her body   she was declined by corporate insurance. She persisted  going through the appeals processes  always the opimist with a positive and courageous mindset.Karen believed that the insurance would do the right thing when presented with the medical evidence from her providers.  That did not occur.  Soon after the final appeal was denied  she met with the Proton Beam Therapy program from Loma Linda University Hospital  and was informed that the cost of Proton Beam Therapy as a private pay patient would be $27 000.   Karen and her family were faced with a hard decision between two options  both with significant risks.  Ultimately  and with the encouragement of loved ones  they chose the financial risk over the long-term global health risks associated with the radiation and chemotherapy option covered by the insurance plan. Karen and Craig are nearing retirement  and have three college aged children.   As the ever generous and giving caregiver  Karen is in need of some support from her loved ones and extended community of friends and colleagues.  Every little bit goes a long way in supporting a woman whose life is devoted to the well being of others.  The goal of this campaign is to reduce the financial stress and impact of private pay cancer treatment on Karen and her family. A reduction of stress will allow Karen to focus her energy on healing  giving her the best chance to respond favorably and rapidly to her treatment.  Please help us in our support of Karen Armstrong.

Sam  my mother's cousin and best friend was recently diagnosed with Stage III bladder cancer. With a fresh new move and a new lease on life  Sam was looking to start his next adventure in Tahoe. As fate would have it  he was diagnosed with cancer. With no health insurance and no immediate family  Sam has opted not to seek treatment. This fund was created to make his journey for the next 18-24mo as comfortable as possible  medicinally.  Bladder cancer is one of the most painful cancers to endure.

￼Donna Patel had a very sudden and RARE illness occur in October of 2018. She is an extremely active  hardworking  and outgoing elementary teacher that has completely lost her ability to work! She spends her year working in the states and her summers teaching abroad and traveling. In October of 2018  she was diagnosed with Varicella-Zoster Meningitis  which was found after a lumbar puncture and it indicated that she had 388 White Blood Cells in her cerebral-spinal fluid. Neurologists begin to worry when the white blood cell count is at 10!!Her infectious disease doctor has clearly stated that she could have been paralyzed or died if she didn't get to the ER any sooner! Between the various infectious disease doctors and multiple neurologists that have looked into her case  NONE of them have seen a case like Donna's before. In other words  she basically grew shingles in her brain! As of now  doctors are still trying to figure out how to treat the patient's rare form of Varicella-Zoster Meningitis  but with very little literature/studies done on this diagnosis  it has been difficult. Most patients with Meningitis are treated for 7-10 days with IV antibiotic  but Donna is currently at 37 days of aggressive treatment through a picc line to her heart with routine doctors visits. Her RARE form of Meningitis has caused more complication with her case. Recently  she was diagnosed with Left Hemiparesis and TRANSVERSE MYELITIS (VERY UNCOMMON)  which was caused after a mini stroke on 11-16-2018 and she was admitted to the Neurology unit at IMC. She has spent a total of 30+ days in the hospital  continues to make trips to the ER  (due to nerve damage) among other things  and has lost her mobility on the left side of her body. As well as  having difficulty with immediate memory loss  sensitivity to light (explains the sunglasses)  and fine motor skills (can not text for longer than 10 minutes or write with a pen). She is currently on home health nursing  has trouble keeping food down  is using a walker  has occupational therapy  physical therapy  behavioral health counseling and continues IV treatment  among several other daily prescription medications. She went from teaching and traveling around the world to save/protect animals to being a girl that's trapped in an \old man's body \" as she would say. On top of everything else  she is losing all of her hair and we all know how beautiful her naturally long hair is and how much she LOVES it. She's been a warrior through all of this  but losing her hair has been tough! Along with missing the entire holiday season  starting with Halloween and now we are almost to Christmas but things are not looking up. Missing Halloween was a hard pill for Donna's creative self to swallow  since she has two awesome costumes for this year  but having to go to the ER on Thanksgiving was even more earth shattering for her. It was bad enough that she did not get to spend her Thanksgiving cooking up a storm as usual  but even worse with the nerve pain and the inability to even sit down or to hug anyone due to the extreme pain she is enduring!! Her birthday is coming up in just a few days and this will be her worst/saddest birthday to date. The holiday season will pass her by and although she continues to stay as positive as she can  we all know this has jaded her spirit. Please send positive vibes her way! We need all the love and support she can get! As of now  DP is drowning in medical bills and is physically and mentally (memory loss) unable to work. Losing her ability to work has most certainly hit her hard because she LOVES her job more than anything else in the world.  It is now up the neurologists and Donna's rehab recovery progress  for the coming year. She is a young female living in the state of Utah where she is not able to collect any kind of short term or long term disability due to her age and is not making any income at all. She has no idea how she is going to pay for her next health insurance premium  phone bill  car insurance  rent  or even utilities. Getting Medicaid has been a serious issue in the state of Utah! There is no specific timeline on how long her disabilities will continue  but the doctors at Johns Hopkins  in Maryland  have suggested that it should take 6 months. We are praying for a full vision  physical  and hopefully full brain recovery as well! D's memory and concentration loss has been the most difficult part of this process for her. ANY AND ALL HELP WOULD BE GREATLY APPRECIATED AND DP WOULD BE FOREVER GRATEFUL FOR YOU! At this point she has spent all of her savings to pay for her health insurance premiums  which are super high and has no financial support in other ways. PLEASE help us RAISE 'TM' AWARENESS and DO IT FOR D!!!! THANK YOU IN ADVANCE! --WITH LOVE  P.S.The funds from this Campaign will be withdrawn to get D through physical therapy and pay for her rent while she is unable to work.My name is Zar and I am D’s significant other  I have been helping her through this healing process and I will be facilitating the funds to her.￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼\"Life is about the journey  not the destination.\" -Anne Coleman"

storyTitle: Help Trevor Smile a Toothy Grin Again!!
story: We are raising money for our beautiful boy Trevor!!  Trevor has had quite a journey in his 27 years on this earth!  Its time to help him become more comfortable in this life by allowing him to eat properly  not hurt so much and fully smile again!!  Its been over two decades since he last smiled a toothy grin.  Why?  When Trevor was just past his 4th birthday he was having trouble sleeping at night.  One night his breathing was stopping and we took him to the ER.  Soon the nightmare began when we were greeted by an Oncologist and told our precious son had a very rare and aggressive cancer.  It turned out he had stage 3 Rhabdomyosarcoma which was inoperable and wrapped all through his sinus cavity and growing down his throat.  Research told us this was very serious and he may have had at the time about a 20% chance of survival. Since it was so aggressive and fast moving  he had a very aggressive treatment regime which started immediately with a maximum dosage of radiation treatments to his head/face.  We were warned by the radiologist that the procedure would be effective in knocking the cancer down but would cause various side effects such as scarring in his throat   mouth and sinus area  damage to his teeth  damage to his facial bones and damage to his pituitary gland and hypothalamus. The radiation was a success and really knocked the cancer down to a point where the next year of chemotherapy could potentially knock it out.  However the radiation was devastating and burned his mouth so badly it was charred black and he was IV fed for a few months.  He had received the maximum dosage of radiation (RADS) over many many treatments.  He was such a trooper and the secret of his success and survival was his tremendously high pain tolerance  tolerance of the medications and his strong resolve to live and do what he was told.  During 1996 Trevor nearly passed away three times due to medication allergies and infections but emerged on the other side still alive.  Since 1996  Trevor has graduated from High School  taken some college classes  earned his Eagle Scout award and is a fine fine young man we all are very proud of.  His love of the wilderness and the mountains keeps him living in a converted van currently in Salt Lake City.  Previously he's lived in Jackson WY and Breckenridge CO.  He is a gifted rock climber and photographer and he see's the world thru very old experienced tranquil eyes that have fought and fought and seen and experienced things no one should have to endure.  He recently picked to live  work and climb in Salt Lake City because one of the most talented surgical prosthodontists resides there and is going to help Trevor with some of the after-effects of his treatment that he struggles with.  Most adults have 18 teeth on our top jaw and 18 on the bottom.  Trevor has only 7 on top as many have fallen out or never came in.  The radiation basically froze his face and lower head into the size and maturity of a 4 year old.  Many of his adult teeth never came in  a number of his baby teeth never fell out until they broke apart and the adult teeth he did have had their roots shortened by the treatment making them all lose.  Four teeth are still up sideways in his gums.  Trevor struggles to eat  has constant pain and just doesn't smile due to the mess he would show if he did.  This Go Fund Me is to raise the funding necessary to remove the last 7 teeth he has plus the 4 that are up in his gums causing pain.  He will receive this treatment as soon as the monies are raised!!  Health insurance won't cover this nor dental due to annual cost limits.  The surgeon will put 4 posts into his jaw bone and put specially fabricated bridges in so that when done Trevor will have a mouth of teeth to be proud of!  His palate is very narrow and small so everything is extra challenging.  The proceeds will pay for his treatment  pay to get him into a hotel room for a week or so to recover so he has clean water  bedding and facilities and allow a family member to fly out and help him during and after surgery.  This won't be the end of Trevor's daily struggles but will at least allow him to eat the foods he wants and reduce his pain levels.  He still is stared at constantly by kids and adults which can be very hurtful to Trevor but kudos to him for living his life and letting most troubles roll of his back.  He even had a man the other day in Georgia get in his face and ask him point blank why he looks like he does.  The guy wasn't even nice about it.  When I'm with Trevor I'm continually blown away by his grace  poise and strength as in the end he is thankful to be alive and thankful for his wonderful life.  He mourns everyday the loss of so many of his friends that weren't as lucky as he to survive this scourge we call pediatric cancer   Thank you for giving what you can to Trevor and please please in the future give to charities that focus on pediatric cancer research and support!  It's badly overlooked and so many kids suffer each and everyday along with their parents and friends.

storyTitle: The Last Act of Lady Jane
story: Our dearest Lady Jane (Mamma Bear) just received the final script for her last act here on Earth. On March  1st  Jane was diagnosed with Stage 4 Pancreatic Cancer that has unfortunately spread to other areas in her body. At this stage  there is no cure or treatment that will make it better.  In her lifetime  she's played many roles - from a guardian to a gatekeeper  a concierge of smiles  a master of music with a song for every occasion - to her most critically acclaimed role - a loving mother of 3 grown children  and grandmother. This diagnosis comes with the understanding that there are only a few weeks or months left before she makes her way to the heavens. This news has been devastating  as nothing can prepare you for the finality of cancer  the hopelessness of treatment options  or the grief that sets in as you realize: This. Is. It. The only thing we can do now is take it a day at a time  and make each day a celebration of life with her loved ones. She has spent her entire life taking care of others  putting her needs last  and offering a welcoming heart to anyone that needed it without question. My wish for her is to know how much she is loved and what an impact she has made along the way.To support her transition into the next life  we are raising funds to cover living expenses and medical costs. Due to the diagnosis  she will no longer be able to work and her health insurance will no longer be covered by her current job. Myself  and my siblings have begun to take over her bills and put together a bucket list of memories to make before her last curtain call. Aside from financial donations  I'd like to start collecting greeting cards to brighten her days with; words of encouragement  a shared memory  or some humor to keep things light as we go down this difficult road together.

Our mother  Graciela Pedroza  suffered a severe stroke on Friday  October 19th while coming back from Mexico. She was in Zacatecas for her father-in-law’s funeral services and was on the road when the stroke occurred. While she was rushed to a Mexican clinic in Juarez  she did not receive proper care and her brain underwent severe damage. Fortunately  she was taken to the University Medical Center in El Paso  Texas  where she is currently receiving medical care. She is surrounded by an amazing staff who are doing everything they can to stabilize her condition. Unfortunately  she does not have health insurance and all of her medical treatment is going to be very expensive. The goal is for her to be stable enough to be returned to her home in Goodyear  AZ. Graciela is a family oriented person of great faith. She is a strong woman and is doing everything she can to fight on. We have faith in God that she will recover from this and that she will once again be the loving  caring  and hard-working woman that we know her to be. The road to recovery will be a long one filled with days of great progress and nerve-wracking setbacks. Anything you can provide to her and her family during this difficult time would be greatly appreciated. Please keep her in your thoughts and prayers. Thank you for all of your support and for taking the time to share and/or donate to this cause. God bless you and your loved ones - Pedroza Family Nuestra madre  Graciela Pedroza  sufrió una embolia cerebral severa el viernes  19 de octubre  mientras regresaba a casa de México. Ella estaba en Zacatecas por los servicios funerarios de su suegro y estaba en la carretera cuando ocurrió. Ella fue apresurada a una clínica Mexicana en Juárez  desafortunadamente ella no recibió la atención apropiada y su cerebro sufrió daño severo. Afortunadamente  fue llevada al centro médico de la Universidad en El Paso  Texas  donde actualmente está recibiendo atención médica. Ella está rodeada por un personal médico increíble que están haciendo todo lo posible para estabilizar su condición. Desafortunadamente  ella no tiene seguro médico y todo su tratamiento médico va a ser muy costoso. El objetivo es que ella sea lo suficientemente estable como para ser devuelta a su casa en Goodyear  AZ. Graciela es una persona orientada a la familia y de gran fe. Ella es una mujer fuerte y está haciendo todo lo posible para luchar y recuperarse. Tenemos fe en Dios que ella se recuperará de esto y que una vez más será la mujer amorosa  cariñosa y trabajadora que sabemos que es. El camino a la recuperación será largo y lleno de días de gran progreso y de reveses estresantes. Todo lo que pueda proporcionarle a ella y a su familia durante este difícil momento sería muy apreciado. Por favor  manténgala en sus pensamientos y oraciones. Gracias por todo su apoyo y por tomarse el tiempo para compartir y/o donar a esta causa. Dios los bendiga a ustedes y a sus seres queridos- Familia Pedroza

storyTitle: Support Maria Battleing Kidney Disease Stage 5
story: Dear  Family  Friends and Friends of Friends As some of you may already know My Mother has been battleing with Kidney Disease for 2 years and unfortunately She has reach Stage 5 Kidney Failure.We are at a point where the hospital has started her on dialysis.We are having issues because She doesn’t apply for health insurance while we figure out the insurance situation we have cover the full cost of dialysis treatment.My mom Maria has always been a happy friendly loving and caring person She is an amazing Mother and  Grandmother She has always been willing and happy to help others.But now She needs our love and support more than ever. During this tough time We will appreciate any support we can get Dialysis is very crucial for her so Please keep her in your prayers.Querida  Familia  Amigos y Amigos de Amigos.Como ya muchos de ustedes saben Mi Madre Maria Garcia a estado luchando por 2 años con problemas de Insuficiencia Renal desafortunadamente ella a llegado a etapa 5 de su enfermedad de Riñon.Estamos en el punto que el hospital la a comenzado en diálisis.Estamos teniendo problemas porque no tiene cobertura médica que se haga cargo de los gastos de diálisis.Mi Madre Maria siempre a sido una persona alegre  amigable  amorosa y llena de vida dispuesta ayudar a otros pero ahora ella necesita nuestro amor y apoyo más que nunca.Durante estos momentos difíciles agradeceríamos mucho su apoyo y cualquier ayuda que nos pudieran proporcionar.Es muy importante que ella reciba el tratamiento para mejorar su condición de Salud.Pedimos Oración por ella y su recuperación.De ante mano agradecemos su ayuda

UPDATE:Wed. 11/07Hi friends and family  I'm out of surgery. I'm on drugs. I am woozy but OK. The nurses and staff here have been very lovely. I have this GoFundMe Campaign to help me cover these extremely high costs. I'm trying to raise $5K for my surgery bills  copays  physical therapy costs  and my unpaid time off work while I recover. If any of you are able to help me out I would be forever in gratitude. Thank you so much! Lots of lovexxJustin-------------Hello Friends It's a bit embarrassing and humbling to ask you all for help  thanks for reading my story. I need to get surgery on my left knee and I'm hoping for some assistance as I get this procedure done and recover.Many of you know me from my involvement in  music. I've been a touring musician since I was 15 years old. I have had the fortunate pleasure of recording and touring with acclaimed underdogs Clorox Girls  Red Dons  LA Drugz  Maniac  and Suspect Parts.As music doesn't pay the bills  I have worked dozens of jobs over the years  and recently became a full-time freelance American Sign Language interpreter. My mom  stepdad  and aunt are deaf  so I grew up immersed in Deaf culture and was able to sign before I could talk. After years of low-paying and soul destroying jobs (including a few excruciating years as a dental supply salesman)  I realized that I could have a rewarding profession working with the Deaf community.  It's going great so far  but as I'm freelance  my income isn't always stable and sometimes it can be difficult as most freelance agencies pay monthly on varying schedules. ASL Interpreting can be a potentially lucrative and fulfilling profession  but in this case I may need a bit of a running start.  So far so good though  some recent highlights include a couple of TV appearances on Jimmy Kimmel and Entertainment Tonight. To keep in shape  I play full court basketball with a group of writers  actors  comedians and a couple of semi-retired comedy writers who wrote for shows like Sanford and Son  Punky Brewster  Seinfeld  and Sister Sister.  One day I tore the meniscus in my left knee in two places and badly bruised my ACL.  At first I could barely walk  and while it did somewhat heal  the docs told me that I need surgery on my left knee or I'm at risk of constant inflammation and pain for the rest of my life. Right now I have discomfort and pain in my knee when climbing stairs  hills  long walks  or any kind of heavy lifting or prolonged physical activity. The docs have scheduled me for a meniscus repair surgery at 7am on Nov 7th 2018.I hope to one day be able to enjoy the physical activities I love again  including long walks  hikes  yoga  full court basketball  and of course a few high kicks onstage with my punk rock bands. I think I can get there with some surgery  physical therapy  and a little help from my friends.It's admittedly embarrassing and humbling to ask for help. I do have health insurance  and they will pay for 80% of my surgery  but I will have to pay about $3000 out of pocket  and I won't be able to work for 2-4 weeks. There will also be co-pays and additional cost for post-surgery physical therapy sessions.  As I'm 100% freelance  unpaid time off work will be very difficult financially. Right now its impossible for me to cover the surgery  related costs  and loss of income on my own. I'm hoping to raise $5K so that I can afford my surgery/medical bills  be prepared for physical therapy costs  and to help cover my bills for the 2-4 weeks I'm unable to work. For some people that might not be a lot of money  but to me it is huge and will help me bounce back. Really appreciate it everyone! Thank you very much for your help.  Lots of love.Your friend Justin Maurer www.justin-maurer.com

It was really a blow to find out a few months ago that for the third time in 7 years  I would have to undergo brain surgery – this time the result of a second serious infection. The first surgery  in 2012  was to remove a large brain tumor (thankfully noncancerous). It was removed successfully  but complications required several months of difficult rehab. Then everything was fine until 2016  when I contracted an infection that went straight to my skull bones  some of which had to be removed and replaced with a metal mesh plate. This Thanksgiving  the metal plate itself became infected and had to be removed. In a second operation  a plastic surgeon covered the area temporarily with a “free flap” made from a skin graft. In 3-6 months  when there is no risk of further infection and the flap is completely healed  I will get a 3-d printed plastic skull plate in one last operation. I don’t really mind losing what little hair I have left (I like colorful scarves)  or even having to wear a silly helmet for several months (I’ve done it before!). But being out of commission for months each time means that it takes that much longer to get back up to speed with life and especially work – and that’s what really worries me. Each time  my life gets put on hold. It’s scary. I have lots of really wonderful  supportive friends  whom I’m tremendously grateful for  but I don’t have a spouse or partner to help with the bills  so I’m on my own. Since I work by the hour  when I’m not working  I’m not earning a living. I am an artist and art teacher  and I love what I do. I work part time for ACE – Adult and Community Enrichment at Suncoast Technical College. I went though my meager savings during the two previous episodes in 2012 and 2016  and have not been able to replenish that “rainy day fund.” I’m trying to figure out what I can do to generate additional income with artwork or something else to give me a buffer against future downtime  but in the meantime  I have to get past this current bump in the road. That’s why I started this GoFundMe page. My small Social Security check will take care of a few vital bills such as my health insurance premium and utilities  but in a couple of weeks I’ll be pretty much out of money until mid-March when a little teaching income comes in again from the classes that start in February. I expect to need about $2000 to help cover the mortgage and expenses for two months until I’m up to speed again. I’m working hard in physical therapy to build my strength and stamina so that I can go back to my job with full strength. If you'd like to see more of my artwork  my website is  www.PatriciaRockwood.com.I will be forever grateful for any amount that you can contribute. Thank you so much.Patricia Rockwood

storyTitle: Please Help My Dad Battle Stage 4 Breast Cancer
story: I know we have not mentioned because we all have been trying to stay strong during this Holiday season  but My Father Mark Pederson was diagnosed with stage 4 Breast Cancer which has spread to his lungs  lymph nodes and spine. I do not know if you have experienced cancer within your family or close loved ones  but it is not the most exciting news especially when it is your Father/Best Friend. Watching someone you use to go jog and exercise with to not being able to walk across a room or do the simple things like get ready or shower at home without stopping to catch their breath from lack of oxygen in lungs is horrific and devastating. I love my father and as much as I can do anything for him physically him not being able to DJ/work full time and having no health insurance has taken a toll on his income and living situation is very hard and rough right now. My family and I are praying and hoping that God restore his health and get this process going so that it takes less stress off of him financially and physically. My family and I please ask if you can pray for his health and finances and to donate anything at all to help him in his time of need that you pray hard about it and if you can help us support him financially during this hard time for us all then please do so. I and my Father have been hard on myself to ask for help during this time as I and my Father never want to ask for help  but the amount of finances he has taken on just my Family and I just can't endure alone. We Love him very much and want to help him so please if you can find it in your hearts to give a little for my Father we ask that you please donate and also pray for his health and recovery. The Pederson Family wishes you a Very Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your support and prayers.God Bless!

Karen Armstrong  is the caregiver  supporter  and cheerleader for so many others.  A through and through special educator  she has devoted her career to helping others achieve to their potential and obtain the resources needed to do so.   Karen is a loving and devoted wife and mother  as anyone who has spent any time with Karen would know  always putting the needs of her family first. Karen is the type of person who you can count on to lift you up when you're down  and never expects anything in return.6-months ago  Karen was diagnosed with breast cancer. She went through her initial diagnosis and surgery with a positive and courageous mindset  and returned to her caregiver role at work and in her personal life soon after the first phase of treatment (despite her family and friends and colleagues concern).  The second phase of treatment approaching  Karen's health insurance provider declined her oncologist's request for Proton Beam Therapy as an alternative to radiation and chemotherapy.  The short and long term health effects differ significantly between the two types of treatment.   Despite Karen's oncology team at Loma Linda University Hospital recommending her as an ideal candidate for Proton Beam Therapy to eradicate the cancer from her body   she was declined by corporate insurance. She persisted  going through the appeals processes  always the opimist with a positive and courageous mindset.Karen believed that the insurance would do the right thing when presented with the medical evidence from her providers.  That did not occur.  Soon after the final appeal was denied  she met with the Proton Beam Therapy program from Loma Linda University Hospital  and was informed that the cost of Proton Beam Therapy as a private pay patient would be $27 000.   Karen and her family were faced with a hard decision between two options  both with significant risks.  Ultimately  and with the encouragement of loved ones  they chose the financial risk over the long-term global health risks associated with the radiation and chemotherapy option covered by the insurance plan. Karen and Craig are nearing retirement  and have three college aged children.   As the ever generous and giving caregiver  Karen is in need of some support from her loved ones and extended community of friends and colleagues.  Every little bit goes a long way in supporting a woman whose life is devoted to the well being of others.  The goal of this campaign is to reduce the financial stress and impact of private pay cancer treatment on Karen and her family. A reduction of stress will allow Karen to focus her energy on healing  giving her the best chance to respond favorably and rapidly to her treatment.  Please help us in our support of Karen Armstrong.

Sam  my mother's cousin and best friend was recently diagnosed with Stage III bladder cancer. With a fresh new move and a new lease on life  Sam was looking to start his next adventure in Tahoe. As fate would have it  he was diagnosed with cancer. With no health insurance and no immediate family  Sam has opted not to seek treatment. This fund was created to make his journey for the next 18-24mo as comfortable as possible  medicinally.  Bladder cancer is one of the most painful cancers to endure.

storyTitle: Help Trevor Smile a Toothy Grin Again!!
story: We are raising money for our beautiful boy Trevor!!  Trevor has had quite a journey in his 27 years on this earth!  Its time to help him become more comfortable in this life by allowing him to eat properly  not hurt so much and fully smile again!!  Its been over two decades since he last smiled a toothy grin.  Why?  When Trevor was just past his 4th birthday he was having trouble sleeping at night.  One night his breathing was stopping and we took him to the ER.  Soon the nightmare began when we were greeted by an Oncologist and told our precious son had a very rare and aggressive cancer.  It turned out he had stage 3 Rhabdomyosarcoma which was inoperable and wrapped all through his sinus cavity and growing down his throat.  Research told us this was very serious and he may have had at the time about a 20% chance of survival. Since it was so aggressive and fast moving  he had a very aggressive treatment regime which started immediately with a maximum dosage of radiation treatments to his head/face.  We were warned by the radiologist that the procedure would be effective in knocking the cancer down but would cause various side effects such as scarring in his throat   mouth and sinus area  damage to his teeth  damage to his facial bones and damage to his pituitary gland and hypothalamus. The radiation was a success and really knocked the cancer down to a point where the next year of chemotherapy could potentially knock it out.  However the radiation was devastating and burned his mouth so badly it was charred black and he was IV fed for a few months.  He had received the maximum dosage of radiation (RADS) over many many treatments.  He was such a trooper and the secret of his success and survival was his tremendously high pain tolerance  tolerance of the medications and his strong resolve to live and do what he was told.  During 1996 Trevor nearly passed away three times due to medication allergies and infections but emerged on the other side still alive.  Since 1996  Trevor has graduated from High School  taken some college classes  earned his Eagle Scout award and is a fine fine young man we all are very proud of.  His love of the wilderness and the mountains keeps him living in a converted van currently in Salt Lake City.  Previously he's lived in Jackson WY and Breckenridge CO.  He is a gifted rock climber and photographer and he see's the world thru very old experienced tranquil eyes that have fought and fought and seen and experienced things no one should have to endure.  He recently picked to live  work and climb in Salt Lake City because one of the most talented surgical prosthodontists resides there and is going to help Trevor with some of the after-effects of his treatment that he struggles with.  Most adults have 18 teeth on our top jaw and 18 on the bottom.  Trevor has only 7 on top as many have fallen out or never came in.  The radiation basically froze his face and lower head into the size and maturity of a 4 year old.  Many of his adult teeth never came in  a number of his baby teeth never fell out until they broke apart and the adult teeth he did have had their roots shortened by the treatment making them all lose.  Four teeth are still up sideways in his gums.  Trevor struggles to eat  has constant pain and just doesn't smile due to the mess he would show if he did.  This Go Fund Me is to raise the funding necessary to remove the last 7 teeth he has plus the 4 that are up in his gums causing pain.  He will receive this treatment as soon as the monies are raised!!  Health insurance won't cover this nor dental due to annual cost limits.  The surgeon will put 4 posts into his jaw bone and put specially fabricated bridges in so that when done Trevor will have a mouth of teeth to be proud of!  His palate is very narrow and small so everything is extra challenging.  The proceeds will pay for his treatment  pay to get him into a hotel room for a week or so to recover so he has clean water  bedding and facilities and allow a family member to fly out and help him during and after surgery.  This won't be the end of Trevor's daily struggles but will at least allow him to eat the foods he wants and reduce his pain levels.  He still is stared at constantly by kids and adults which can be very hurtful to Trevor but kudos to him for living his life and letting most troubles roll of his back.  He even had a man the other day in Georgia get in his face and ask him point blank why he looks like he does.  The guy wasn't even nice about it.  When I'm with Trevor I'm continually blown away by his grace  poise and strength as in the end he is thankful to be alive and thankful for his wonderful life.  He mourns everyday the loss of so many of his friends that weren't as lucky as he to survive this scourge we call pediatric cancer   Thank you for giving what you can to Trevor and please please in the future give to charities that focus on pediatric cancer research and support!  It's badly overlooked and so many kids suffer each and everyday along with their parents and friends.

storyTitle: The Last Act of Lady Jane
story: Our dearest Lady Jane (Mamma Bear) just received the final script for her last act here on Earth. On March  1st  Jane was diagnosed with Stage 4 Pancreatic Cancer that has unfortunately spread to other areas in her body. At this stage  there is no cure or treatment that will make it better.  In her lifetime  she's played many roles - from a guardian to a gatekeeper  a concierge of smiles  a master of music with a song for every occasion - to her most critically acclaimed role - a loving mother of 3 grown children  and grandmother. This diagnosis comes with the understanding that there are only a few weeks or months left before she makes her way to the heavens. This news has been devastating  as nothing can prepare you for the finality of cancer  the hopelessness of treatment options  or the grief that sets in as you realize: This. Is. It. The only thing we can do now is take it a day at a time  and make each day a celebration of life with her loved ones. She has spent her entire life taking care of others  putting her needs last  and offering a welcoming heart to anyone that needed it without question. My wish for her is to know how much she is loved and what an impact she has made along the way.To support her transition into the next life  we are raising funds to cover living expenses and medical costs. Due to the diagnosis  she will no longer be able to work and her health insurance will no longer be covered by her current job. Myself  and my siblings have begun to take over her bills and put together a bucket list of memories to make before her last curtain call. Aside from financial donations  I'd like to start collecting greeting cards to brighten her days with; words of encouragement  a shared memory  or some humor to keep things light as we go down this difficult road together.

On Oct. 15  2018  I received devastating news when my doctor told me  Allan Kahkonen  58 years old  from St. George  UT  that I have cancer. Shock was followed by disbelief. This is a rarer and very difficult cancer to cure – Multiple Myeloma and it is in the serious advanced stage 3. MIRs of my chest and back exposed the large number of myeloma cells present as lesions all over my bones. A PET scan was able to show just how extensive and invasive the cancer is in the bones of my body. Additionally  I had a bone marrow biopsy of my left hip which revealed that it is 95 % infected. This nasty cancer has caused me to have severe pain throughout my chest and back  intense fatigue  extreme muscle weakness  limitation of mobility  and a complete lack of energy and stamina. It is very difficult for me to get up and down due to the pain and the instability of the bones. Thus  I am no longer able to work. I was a hard working truck driver and this job required heavy lifting. It is impossible for me to earn a living now. I am on chemotherapy of Velcade  Dexamethasone  and Revlimid for 5 to 6 months. The chemo is directed against the myeloma cells but it also is used to help with the intense pain associated with this cancer. I am also receiving an injection of Xgeva monthly to help delay or prevent the weakening of my bones. When the chemo is completed I will have to undergo a Stem Cell Transplant. This requires a stay of a month in the hospital. If it is successful then I will remain on the cancer drugs for another two years. The initial treatment plan can be more than 2 ½ years if the Stem Cell Treatment is successful. If it isn’t successful the first time it could be 4 years or more of battling this horrific cancer.I am now paying for health insurance myself and will be responsible for the out-of-pocket and co-pay expenses for the current year and the new subsequent health insurance plan for next year - this will be about $7  000 to $8 000 up front. The costs for chemo are $12 000 to $17 000 a month and Cobra Insurance will be $700 plus a month. Horror stories of health care companies simply dropping you because it is costing them too much money are prevalent. I have already received two letters with disclaimers of responsibility of payment for chemo medication and a notification that they are not paying. We are fighting that decision. Peter J. Pitts  president of a division at the Center for Medicine stated  “Drug coverage denials are a deadly prescription for people with cancer.” On Nov. 1  2018  I applied for Social Security Disability. I was told by them that it will be at least five or six months but my doctor said that it can take a year or more. All that time with no income and large amounts of money going out constantly is overwhelming. I am hopeful of obtaining enough money right away to help get me through the first five or six months and maybe even the Stem Cell Treatment. If you could help I would be grateful. - Pentti Allan Kahkonen and wife Delores

After all she's been through in the past (see the post below)  our Chrissy is dealing with yet another health crisis.  This time  they found 3 small masses on her brain that have come together as one larger mass.  The masses are causing her to lose her vision and her hearing in her left ear.  She will need several surgeries  including brain surgery to remove the masses  and surgery to repair the damage that the pressure of the tumors has caused to her eye.  While we are having a Stella & Dot fundraiser (jewelry) on Facebook  so that she can earn commissions and  continue to feel like she's contributing to her own life and supporting herself.  She will be unable to work for some time and will need help financially.  Her job does not provide any benefits such as disability so she will be without pay for quite some time.  This on the heels of just really getting her life back.If you're not familiar with her challenges in the past  I'm leaving the fundraiser below so that you can read about what she went through 2 short years ago.  We as a family have been through so much and we're fighting this time too!  Any help you can give would be greatly appreciated.  She is such a loving and giving person.  She raised over $3 500 this past August at her 40th birthday party for the Crohns and Colitis Foundation as a way to give back and to support that organization that is doing research for the millions of people suffering from those conditions  including Chrissy and several other people she loves.If you have any questions or wish to talk to me  please find me on Facebook or if you already know me  give me a call or text.Thank you so much from our entire family Love Judy ************************************************FROM 2015/2016:My daughter is very ill and needs some help.  She hasn't made a big deal out of it but she has dealing with Ulcerative Colitis for several years now.  It has progressed at an alarming rate to the point where surgical intervention is the only option and potentially - a cure!   She has finally found a great doctor at HUP who has said he will make her well.  Making her well involves removing her entire colon to remove all of the diseased sections. This involves 3 separate surgeries over the course of 6 months  an ostomy and a rough road of recovery each time.  She has been dealing with incredible pain and if you know anything about UC  you know all of the horrible symptoms of this bowel disease but also what effect the medicines take on a body.  She has lost 35 pounds in a few months because she can't keep things down  or the opposite  her body keeps things in and her colon gets infected and she bloats.  Through all of this she has tried to stay strong!  She has made sure she attended the family birthday parties  sending care packages to her baby brother  Christopher  who is deployed till 2016  supporting her sister-in-law in any way she can with the nephews and niece.  She raises funds for so many worthwhile causes because she believes in helping find a cure for those diseases that affect and have affected those she loves - Liver foundation donations in honor of her cousin Olivia; Diabetes in honor of her grandmother Ellen Gipson; Asthma  in honor of her mother(humbly  me); UC  herself and several siblings; Crohn's  'Amber Tyson  and so many people I can't name; Cancer  her grandmother and so many others; Multiple Sclerosis  her wonderful uncle Joseph Gipson;  Heart Association in honor of her grandfathers and father ;and so many others I can't count.  She has raised tens of thousands of dollars in the past 10 years for so many organizations.  Now  she needs people to help her.  She would never ask for this herself.  I think she'd sooner scream at the sky by herself than ask for help.  So I'm asking for her.  She is now at the point of exhausting her short-term disability benefits  and has been paying her own health insurance premiums since her company has stopped doing so because she's on disability.   As of November 26  she will no longer have any disability  and yet she'll still have to pay for her health insurance premiums  in order to get the next 2 required surgeries.  She has exhausted her savings with her medical bills  medications and living expenses.I believe that $5 000 is a good goal  a decent goal  that will help her pay for her health insurance  her medications  ostomy supplies  costs of living and the costs of getting well for the next six months.  This beautiful young woman has been through so much and hasn't asked for anything but gives to everyone. Anything you can give would be appreciated.  Let's help her get back on her feet so she can start giving back again  which is what she does best.Thank you Judy

Shawn was diagnosed with Colon Cancer in July 2016  nearly three years ago.  The doctors at the Moffitt Cancer Center said it was Stage 4 and that it had spread to his lymph nodes and liver.  Thus began a series of counter measures to stop the cancer's progression.  Chemotherapy was draining and arduous.  But he never complained  continued to work and play his music  even while feeling terrible.  As time moved ahead  Shawn endured a roller coaster of ups and downs: feeling good and gaining weight  only to fall back to more weight loss and nausea.  As time went on  he could no longer work because he didn't have the strength.  Without work  there is no income or health insurance.  Without income  you can't pay rent  there is no money for food  no way to pay the various bills  can't buy gas to get to the doctors or hospital.  Forget about all the medical bills that are adding up.  His situation was getting dire.  But still he doesn't complain or share with others how bad it is getting.   Those of us who see him every week or talk with him daily know  it was time to step in to help him.  That is why this Go-Fund-Me page came about.Shawn has always enjoyed the fast life; playing music in various bands (including The Mike Allman Band  son of Allman Brothers founder Gregg Allman)  driving Corvettes  and working for NASCAR for a time.  He loves his Vettes... Today Shawn  just finished a weeks' stay at the hospital  he is back there getting his stomach drained of fluid now (something he has to do every 2-3 days).  He has lost a lot of weight and there isn't much else the doctors have to offer in terms of remission.   The picture on the left was taken recently  the one on the right was taken in December.  The time is approaching where comfort and pain management will be the only course of treatment.  So  he needs your help as he faces the end-of-life decisions and expenses.  A kind word  a note on Facebook or a personal call  text or e-mail are all appropriate.   Let him know he is loved and will always be a part of your life.   A donation will go a long way toward helping him have some peace of mind as he makes difficult decisions in the coming months.  Knowing he can pay his bills will help tremendously...  Thank you so much!

Jonathan Freitas (Johnny) is a husband  a father of four  and a grandfather of 2 1/2 grand babies. He absolutely loves the Mets  Giants  Snacks  and his career of banking. You can find Johnny on a lazy afternoon sleeping on the couch with a grandbaby sleeping on his belly. He truly loves to be around his family. What began with a small limp resulted with multiple  Doctor visits  in and out of Urgent Care and the Emergency Room; it was originally mis-diagnosed with Arthritis in his knees. The small limp gradually progressed to needing a cane  then a walker  then ultimately him not being able to use his legs at all and using a wheel chair. Another misdiagnoses of bulging disk in his back was then given. On Thursday  February 14th  Jonathan went to get into his wheelchair to go to work when suddenly he felt a crack in his leg. The ambulance was called and he was transported to Orange Regional where it was discovered that his FEMUR bone had broken.  They also found blood clots in his lungs. Due to the blood clots he wasn't able to have surgery until 4 days later. During surgery  doctors discovered the break was caused by a tumor found on his leg. Another one was also found on his hip. Biopsies came back with a diagnosis of lymphoma. Now Johnny faces the long term journey of recovering from his broken leg and chemo and radiation.CURRENT NEEDS: The unfortunate timing of these events coincide with the fact he just started a brand new job and does not have health insurance. It will be a long hard journey  but we know that he will persevere. All prayers and donations would be greatly appreciated.

storyTitle: Please help Kylee pay her medical bills!
story: HELLO!!!!!!! We all know and love Kylee and right now she needs our help. In September  Kylee travelled to St Louis with Anthony to see Taylor Swift on the Reputation World Tour when her appendix started rotting inside of her body. This meant that she had to go to the emergency room the night before the show and ended up not being able to see Taylor. Kylee loves Taylor so much and Taylor has been there for her through really hard times over the last few years  so it was devastating. However  her worries were far from over. Her appendix issue was the worst that her surgeon had ever seen  causing the infection to leak into other parts of her body and making Kylee borderline septic which nearly landed her in the ICU. So after the operation  Kylee took a long time to heal  her antibiotics weren’t working  and they had to put a tube in my stomach and a PICC line in her arm which lasted for weeks and put her pretty much out of commission for way longer than most people would have been. This was obviously a painful and depressing and all around terrible experience which nobody deserves  but especially not Kylee.At the time she had health insurance through her work  but she no longer works at that particular job so she now has had to depend on government funded insurance  which is  to be frank  terrible. Her bills total over $42 000. She can’t afford it. She was worrying to me about what she’s going to do and I suggested making a gofundme  but she said she could never ask people for money. Well  I’m asking for her. Kylee is not and has never been wealthy but since I’ve known her she’s been generous to a fault  always sharing what little she has with others. Only just recently a mutual friend had a loved one pass away very unexpectedly and  despite having all this  debt  Kylee organised for us all to send this person flowers so they knew we were thinking of them. She’s always thinking of others and what she can do to make people’s lives better and I think it’s about time for us others to do the same for her. Don’t worry if you can’t donate much (or at all)  just know that every little bit helps. Please donate if you’re able to. Kylee almost didn’t even let me make this because she felt so guilty about asking people for money but that’s exactly why she deserves it.

18 months ago  my family’s lives were changed forever. My Father was diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of brain cancer called GBM (Glioblastoma Multiforme). He has been on cancer-fighting treatments  and they have not been as effective as we wished in his battle  and he now has taken a turn and has had to be put in hospice care.My father was the sole provider for our family of four  and we are struggling to pay for his medical expenses and near passing/end of life expenses. He thought he was paying on a life insurance policy  only to find  unfortunately  that it was an accidental and dismemberment policy instead  which could lead my sister  mother  dog and I  homeless.My dad was a good husband and father. My parents agreed that my mother would be a stay at home mom. She has never missed any of our school functions and was a volunteer at our school for many years.Due to these recent traumatic events  my mom's anxiety disorder has gotten worse  and without any help  I’m afraid that my mother may become ill and she has no health insurance.My father served in the U.S. Army for six years and then pursued as a career Military contract work. He has always had a great love for God  his family  and country.If anyone can help us... PLEASE... it would be a great blessing to a family in need.

storyTitle: Buying Time for Robin to Heal
story: BUYING TIME FOR ROBIN TO HEALRobin Doughman was rushed to the hospital by ambulance late one night just before Christmas when he could hardly breathe. He had appointments with the doctor multiple times and was told first he had pneumonia and then COPD. He followed all the directives  but it became clear the medications weren’t helping him.   Rhiannon and I were stunned when we were told he did not have COPD. He was diagnosed with a pulmonary embolism. The emergency room doctor told us he came all too close to death. His heart was damaged  but his prognosis is good. His heart is expected to heal itself over the next 3 to 4 months. His lungs are healing too  and his breathing is not as labored as it was in December. He no longer requires oxygen and his health is improving each day. We are grateful he will make an almost full recovery. We are also grateful our health insurance will cover almost all his medical bills. To make matters even more complicated I was admitted to the hospital in another emergency in early January. I’ve recovered and my medical expenses are also covered.The problem is Robin is unable to work in his studio or continue the work with Spanish mustangs that he has been doing for decades. It's already been two and a half months and our emergency funds have been depleted. We cannot make all the ends meet  especially since Robin’s recovery will be 3 – 4 more months. We are self-employed in a family business which is impacted by Robin’s absence. Each day it is expected that he’ll be able to do more  but we are hoping you will help us buy time for his recovery.It’s humbling to be in a situation such as this. We are having trouble buying firewood  food  and everyday expenses  along with paying our utility bills. Please help us with a donation so we can make ends meet until that happy day in May or June when Robin is back on his feet and in his studio building beautiful furniture and screen doors and working in the corral with his Spanish mustangs  Arapaho and Ruby.  Our gratitude runs very deep.Thank you INCENTIVESAll donors will receive a digital copy of The Roan Mare by Robin Doughman.We are pleased to offer incentives for large donations. We have a handmade heirloom Rocking Burro and also a Rocking Bison by Robin and Connie Doughman available for those making a $1500 donation – See rocking toys here:   http://rockridgestudios.com/rocking-toys.html For a $4000 donation paintings by Robin Doughman selected from group of 5’ x 5’ paintings are offered – See paintings here:  http://rockridgestudios.com/robin-doughman.html Robin has his Master of Fine Arts degree in painting and printmaking from Miami University in Oxford  Ohio.

storyTitle: Reversing Cognitive Decline for David Decalo
story: Last month David received a diagnosis of early dementia from the neurology clinic at UC Health in Denver.  While David has been experiencing some cognitive and speech impairment for the past 24 months  we  were taken back by the diagnosis of dementia.  Our family is using this painful situation to rise up and overcome what some doctors think is an inevitable decline from here.  We are enthusiastic about alternative treatments available for neurological disorders in the functional medicine field  especially those pioneered and researched by Dr. Dale Bredesen.  We have chosen to pursue functional medicine to prevent further decline and address David's health issues with a more integrative and personalized medical approach. Last week we interviewed with Dr. Dan LaPerriere  the lead doc at Front Range Functional Medicine and we are encouraged to hear that he believes David's brain health can be restored.Here is Dr. Dan's website:  https://frontrangefunctionalmedicine.comDr. Dan describes the benefits of the protocol on his website as follows: There has been no cure for Alzheimer’s disease. However  new research shows that we can intervene by addressing the various causes of brain inflammation and restore healthy brain function especially if this is found early on. Dr LaPerriere is a certified practitioner in Dr Bredesen’s reversing cognitive decline protocol.As a family we have always believed in the power of preventative and natural medicine. However many of the natural modalities  including the functional medicine approach  are not covered by health insurance.  Presently  David is undergoing extensive brain imaging and cognitive tests  genetic tests and other lab work involved in getting to the core of David's particular illness. The tests and intensive treatments are expensive.  We are reaching out to our community  friends and family who can  and would like to contribute to our GoFundMeCampaign   Reversing David's Cognitive Decline. David's condition is at a critical stage; one that offers hope of reversal.  He and our family are choosing to  be part of the leading edge in personalized natural medicine; not only to help David but to help others come to understand how diseases once thought irreversible can be treated with these new research-based  innovative modalities. Initial tests and interviews with Dr. Dan at Front Range Functional Medicine in Louisville Colorado will start the week of February 25  2019  six days after David's 67th birthday. The Reversing Cognitive Decline program is ongoing for the next year and will cost approximately $11 000 directly to Front Range Functional Medicine. An additional several thousand dollars is needed for out of pocket costs for nutritional and lifestyle change and support.  David worked hard all his life as a fruit sales and marketing entrepreneur to support his family. Due to his decline in health for the past 3 years he has exhausted his savings. It is with much love  optimism  and gratitude that we ask you to contribute to help David and us  his family  through this health challenge.

Andy was diagnosed with colon cancer in December of 2017. The cancer treatment process has been a rollercoaster of ups and downs since it began. Like most cancer fighters  Andy has lost most of his hair  battles sickness and exhaustion on a daily basis  and is trying to keep working in between his treatments. To catch up on the current medical and treatment situation details check out his Caring Bridge site here. https://www.caringbridge.org/visit/andyfawleyThe latest news is that Andy and Patty have traveled down to MD Anderson Cancer Hospital in Houston  Texas where Andy has been accepted into a clinical trial. This is exciting and brings a bit of hope  but also a good amount of stress and concern. The logistics of the visit are difficult to coordinate and they are doing what they can to try and make this treatment cycle as smooth as possible. The clinical trail that Andy has been accepted into will be quite rigorous with a treatment once a week for one month that comes with a lengthy list of side effects.  We are hoping for the best but at this time we have no way to know how he will respond. This treatment will require staying near MD Anderson Hospital in Houston  Texas. Thankfully  Andy and Patty have been connected to an organization that offers lower cost housing but that still adds up over the whole month of treatment. Patty has been using her family medical leave from work in order to be by Andy's side through this fight  but in order to pay for the regular bills  health insurance  medical bills  food  and the lodging in Texas they will need a miracle.This is where you come in... It's been a joy to watch as God has answered prayers about previous financial stresses and breaking down walls of pride over the last year. We know that we couldn't do this fight alone and we appreciate your gifts and encouragement to keep going. Thank You All The Fawley Family

storyTitle: Help Our Dad Have a Stress-Free Recovery!
story: On March 10th  2019  our lives were forever changed when our Mom found our Dad lying on the floor of the bathroom as he suffered from a massive hemorrhagic stroke. It is a miracle that our Mom found him right away and was able to call 9-1-1 and get him transported to the hospital immediately. This literally saved his life! He was in the ICU for the first 2 weeks as his blood pressure could not be regulated. He has responded very well and is currently at a physical therapy and rehabilitation facility where he’s working really hard and receiving intensive treatment on a daily basis. He has lost mobility and sensation on the left side of his body  but has already made tremendous strides toward recovery. However  this has all cost him his job where has worked for over 5 years. He no longer has health insurance after his job loss  and the costs of his recovery are astronomical! So we are turning to our friends  family  and compassionate caring people for help. Our family has always counted on both of parent’s income to make ends meet  pay the bills  and keep a roof over our heads. So against their prideful wishes  I’ve made this fundraising page and really hope that you all find it in your hearts to donate. Any amount will make a difference and will mean the world to us.In case you want to know a bit more about our Dad  here’s the scoop: Our Dad is the coolest guy ever  and we know many kids probably say that  but we really mean it. He is only 42 years old  and because he is the strongest man we’ve ever met  its extremely difficult to sit here and watch him suffer and stress over how he will get better and on top of that how he will pay for all our needs. He is the type of guy who is the first one to help any friend that is in need. We have seen him welcome and help out so many new Cuban families because he’s lived through their struggle and doesn’t want them to feel alone in the process of settling into a new country. Not only is he the most selfless  kind  and hard working man  but he’s always the one person we can look to for support  advice  and unconditional love. For once in our lives  we want to reverse the roles and take care of our Dad like he takes care of us and everyone else.Thank you for reading this and for any way that you can support us. We truly appreciate it and hope you can help in any way.Dani  Debbie  and Diego.

storyTitle: Help Tillie raise funds for Cancer Treatment
story: Hello all  In December 2018  I was fired from my job which  I had been working for 38 years. I lost all of my health insurance  benefits and am currently living off the money I received from my unused PTO.Just last week  I went to the hospital after being in pain day in and day out for over a year. Upon being admitted into the hospital the doctors diagnosed me  with Stage 4 Cancer. At this present time  I am the sole provider for my brother who is mentally challenged  and also help take care of my two sisters who are disabled.The doctors have recommended  surgery to remove the cancer and I am scheduled to begin chemotherapy treatments in the next coming weeks.Your donation today will allow me to continue to pay for my household finances and overall basic needs  as I will not have the ability to search for work while in treatment. Please help me in the fight for my life!!Thank you for your generosity and support during this time of need

G O O D  N E W S !  First of all  we want to thank our amazing God for a successful kidney transplant on January 3  2019! Mom and Cindy (donor) are both safely recovering at home. We also want to thank all of you for your abundant prayers  wishes  thoughts  encouragement  gifts  and support. We are so blessed to have such a strong community and supportive family. This has been amazing to witness! Us “Poetter” kids wanted to do something to help further support our mom and dad  which led us to start this fundraising page. We had previously discussed options with mom who graciously and humbly declined several times. However  a few days before surgery we were discussing the cost of surgery  the lost wages she will have  the travel expenses  her health insurance premiums and deductibles  and the money already spent last year in preparation for dialysis and the transplant. The numbers added up quickly and became overwhelming. Our parents have spent their whole lives giving to others in many ways without asking for anything in return. Now  us kids have decided to reach out and be their voice to ask for help. We ask that if you are compelled  please give what is right in your heart - every cent counts. Also consider sharing this link whether or not you are able to donate. We thank you all for supporting our parents through this challenging time. And keep the prayers coming for Mom and Cindy! Blessings to You All  The Poetter Family.......................................................................................................................................................................................................................Below is Ann's story in her own words:“Do I have an amazing story of the power of prayer and God’s grace! With my transplant surgery tomorrow (1/3/19) there have been many emotions the past few days but I am at peace. As I reflect on this whole kidney ride I am in awe of all the prayers that have gone up for me from all of you.
