story: Jonny (FKA Jenn) Cameron has been a tireless cheerleader and advocate for the LGBTQ+ community since the mid-90s. This human has devoted their entire queer life to helping folks find community and safety. They spearheaded the opening of the LGBT resource center at Northwestern University back in 2004  and found great joy connecting young people to resources and being a friendly mentor. Jonny (Jenn) is a founding member of Up North Pride  an organization that has built one of the largest Pride events in Michigan in just 6 years. Their love  patience  and warmth is felt by everyone around them. Our community is a stronger  brighter place with them in it. We are all deserving of care. We live in a world that often falls short from meeting our basic needs. Gender confirmation is necessary medical care. For many  it is life and death.This Friday  (3/8/19) Jonny will undergo a bilateral mastectomy aka chest reconstruction aka gender confirmation surgery in Ann Arbor. They are grateful to find the care they need  but it requires travel downstate  and a week-long stay at the hospital-hotel. The recovery time is up to 6 weeks  during which Jonny will be unable to lift more than a few pounds  drive or work. Elon will be out of work and with Jonny as primary caretaker during this time. After that  we will rely on friends/family to make sure that Jonny is fed  watered and looked after. Back in 2017  Jonny and Elon started paying ungodly monthly premiums for a health insurance policy that was more likely than most to cover the procedure. Twenty months later  they will finally have this transformative procedure. Insurance will partially cover the cost of surgery  but the out of pocket costs including travel  hotel  and Jonny out of work will be upwards of $8500. Until healthcare is accessible to all  let us join together to stand by our values  and to show our love and support to Jonny. Donated funds will go directly to paying the out of pocket/out of work costs for Jonny to heal and recover.Please join me in the opportunity to support this dear human as they embark on this next phase of their life. Give what you can  and please share this link!

storyTitle: Bianca & Her Kidneys Need Our Help!
story: Hello lovely people! My dear friend Bianca Gaspar is facing a hugely difficult health challenge at the moment. She was recently diagnosed with Stage 4 Kidney Disease. Unfortunately  her health insurance isn’t covering the cost for a biopsy to understand where her treatment can begin  let alone her treatment costs. Now that Bianca has received support to afford her biopsy thanks to you all  let's support her so that when her treatment plan is determined next week she will be able to move forward with her doctor's recommendations. Bianca is one of the strongest  most giving people I know. She loves deeply and without fear and deserves the same in return from her community  in the form of us supporting her health and her ability to pursue her dreams.She is the most loving aunt to her niece and nephew and a complete joy to all of her family and friends  the sweetest dog mommy  and an overall amazing  fun-loving person. She has been dealing with debilitating fatigue in recent months due to her diagnosis and hasn’t felt like herself. She is headed back to school in January to continue on her journey to become a Child Psychologist. Please support her in her healing journey  so that she can focus on being the student  daughter  sister  friend  partner  and loving healer she is dedicated to be. Bianca’s father passed away from the same disease Bianca is currently facing when she was 16. The doctors at the time said it was most likely not genetic  so Bianca’s recent diagnosis came as a huge surprise. Bianca braved the loss of her father  among other hardships  with strength and resilience  just as she is facing her current circumstances. Now that she has her diagnosis  she is dedicated to facing whatever results she is given and to move forward with treatments that will allow her to live fully.Once a diagnosis is determined  treatment can help slow the progression of kidney disease and when necessary  kidney transplants are available. Thanks to you all  Bianca has her biopsy scheduled for the upcoming week! Through this  her underlying cause will be understood and her doctors will be able to determine her treatment plan as soon as possible. Bianca is attempting to enroll in a health insurance plan outside of her Indian Health Service plan so that her treatment plan will be covered. Bianca deserves to be able to get more than just her biopsy  so let's support her in receiving whatever treatment is recommended for her. There are many costs facing her in this journey and this campaign won't cover all of them but let's help her get started. Please help Bianca as she faces something that no 26-year-old should have to face. Let’s help her focus on continuing to learn and grow and brighten the world with her cheerful demeanor  her unsurpassed humor and her genuine love and connection with her loved ones. Let’s support Bianca’s kidney health so she can focus on life and her dreams!!

My twin sister  Andrea  was diagnosed with Stage 2 Cervical Cancer. Her type of cancer is considered a rare and aggressive form  so her team of doctors immediately started her on a simultaneous treatment of chemotherapy & radiation for the next 8-12 weeks or more. This is a very harsh treatment as she will be getting a few rounds of 2 different types of chemotherapy. It will be a long road ahead of healing and recovery. She has already begun feeling chemo fatigue  weight loss  hair loss  and intense mix of emotions. Andrea is hopeful though! She has faith in her doctors and in her conventional therapy  but she also knows that complementary alternative therapies are instrumental in the healing process. Therefore  she is now seeking natural  alternative modalities such as body work (massage)  regular acupuncture treatments  much needed herbs/supplements and guidance from a Certified Naturopathic Doctor that will complement her conventional cancer treatment in a safe & knowledgeable way. Alternative therapies can help Andrea feel more at ease  relieve her symptoms from chemo and radiation and give her the healing she deserves. Unfortunately  obtaining this complementary  alternative therapy is not cheap and is not covered by her health insurance.She was working full time  but is now on disability indefinitely until she gets better. As we all know  state disability is barely enough to pay for her food  gas  bills and home. Please help me raise funds to help Andrea obtain the alternative healing she needs to get through this. My sister is a beautiful  fun  happy and kind person who has always helped many before herself. It’s her time to receive all the love at this time. I will post updates as often as possible. I am happy to answer any questions about her journey  treatments and use of funds. Thank you for reading! Any amount is appreciated! My family & I are grateful to you all!

Some of you know and most of you don't. 3 years ago my dad was diagnosed with IPF  Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) is a type of lung disease that results in scarring (fibrosis) of the lungs for an unknown reason. Over time  the scarring gets worse and it becomes hard to take in a deep breath and the lungs cannot take in enough oxygen. There is no cure currently to this disease and only treatments that will help slow the process. We have currently exhausted those treatments and the only option left is a lung transplant. My dad is the kindest and most hard working man I have ever known who did his absolute best in providing a roof over my head and meals on the table while growing up.  We didn't have much but we always had what we needed and for that I grew up learning the value of a dollar. I will forever be grateful for him and every thing he has done for me and I am hoping to return the favor.  As of this week  my dad has had to stop working which means that he will no longer have health insurance or means to pay his bills. In order to do the transplant  we need $10 000 initially as like a down payment which we don't have. I don't expect this to bring in much so I will be taking out a personal loan for the cost because  well  I refuse to let my dad die without trying.  Any help is greatly appreciated  even if it's $1.Also  if you can't help  don't feel bad! Just buy my dad a drink next time you see him and we will be just as appreciative because life's too short and he should still enjoy whatever time he may have left.

Kelly was recently diagnosed with stage 3 rectal cancer. Though she does have health insurance  the medical costs are still unbearable. She is currently undergoing chemotherapy. After chemo  she will have to undergo radiation (with more chemo)  and hopefully at the end of it all she will have surgery (most likely more than one). Each time she goes into her appointments she has co pays and her insurance does not cover all the scans  labs  and office visits entirely. Sadly the bills are coming in fast and they are more than the average person is able to keep up with. There is enough stress that comes with a cancer diagnosis that a person should not also have to worry about all of these medical bills as well. She is still trying to work full time while going through treatment but any help will be greatly appreciated. We will keep you updated on her prognosis as we know more and go through this journey with her. We want to say thank you in advance for any type of donation and all of the well wishes.

On October 27  2018  our lives were forever changed. Our father was diagnosed with lung cancer. It started with some back pain that eventually worsened and lead to the doctor who suggested he get an MRI on his back and neck. The results came back and it showed a mass next to his spine on the nerve sheath about 2x1.5cm in size. We did not know at that time if it was cancerous or not. Dad went to a few doctors but ended up back in the emergency room every week. Finally  the last visit on October 27  they did a full MRI and CT scan and that is when they found the mass on his lung  in his liver  and tumors all down his spine. We are devastated. We are at an absolute loss for words but we are hopeful. We are strong because he is strong.      Dad has worked in masonry his whole life  since he was a child  no joke. He has done brick  block  stone  tile  concrete  shotcrete  you name it and he has done it and not only has he done it but he is damn good at it and the best that I have ever seen. He is not one who pains easily. He is the toughest and strongest man I know so when he told us and we saw how much pain he was in  we didn't take it lightly. Dad has worked his rear off his entire life to keep a roof over our heads  food in our bellies  and clothes on our backs. He has given his last dollar to someone in more need of it than him. He would give you the coat and shirt off of his back during a blizzard  because that is my father. He taught us to care for others  nature  and most importantly family and ourselves. This man isn't just our father  he is our best friend and that is why we need your help so badly.      We have an appointment with the oncologist Thursday  November 1  for a consultation. I am hoping they will be able to do something quickly about the tumor that is pressing against his spine which is causing him the most pain. He cannot use his right arm much at this point and has been without sleep for weeks. He is able to sleep but its only for a few hours here and there on and off. We know he is going to need surgery and probably chemo or radiation  we are not 100% positive at what all we are looking at until we do the consult Thursday. But  what we do know  is he is already drowning in debt because of this. Dad was in the middle of getting his company started and up off the ground so he is in between health insurance right now. He is already over $5 000 in debt just from the MRI's and emergency room visits  not to mention the orthopedic surgeon they sent him to before they knew what the situation was and the other doctors he has visited in-between. We need all the help we can get to help him stay as stress free as possible during this whole situation. If we cannot get health insurance for him or financial assistance  because they are very limited in funding  we are terrified that he will be so stressed from the amount of debt that he puts himself into that he won't have the spirit to stay positive and keep a positive outlook which could diminish his outlook on the whole situation. I know he would never give up  that is not in his soul. But  there is only so much one man can take. Please  share this  donate  spread the word. This man has given people a place to call home when they had no home of their own. He has given people food to eat when they had nothing to eat or anyway of paying for food. He is not a saint  believe me  but he is the greatest man I have ever met and he is our best friend and our father. We cannot let him leave this Earth before he sees his grand-babies grow up. We thank you from the very depths of our hearts. We are staying positive and hopeful and expect him to pull through this but we can't do it alone.

Dear Friends  Family  and Community:Today is my birthday  and in celebration  I am making the biggest and hardest ask of my life. I have spent many years helping others  happily committed to my role as a therapist  volunteer  nonprofit worker  and slightly codependent lover & friend  Now  however  I am in a position where I need to put myself front and center and ask for your monetary support.  For those of you who don’t know  I’ve been diagnosed with a recurrence of ovarian cancer  only seven years after my first surgical treatment to remove an ovary. I dream of living a long and healthy life  preserving the vitality of my precious body and remaining ovary  and maybe having a child one day. In an effort to give myself the best chance possible at a happy and healthy future  I’m pursuing both alternative and conventional treatments. Most of these (primarily alternative) are  unfortunately  not covered by health insurance and I do not have the financial resources to pay for them out of pocket. These include ozone therapy  IV therapy  hyperbaric oxygen chamber and infrared saunas  colonics  nutritional supplements and vitamins  hormone and blood testing  psychological therapies  energy healing  and the list goes on. In total  approximately one month of treatment alone costs $5 000. Additionally  standard tests like a PET scan have been rejected by insurance  and if I pursue surgery  it will personally cost me $7 500. I understand there may be deep fears  concerns  and skepticism around the effectiveness of some of my treatments and medical choices. Please trust that I have made these decisions only after extensive research and many inspirational discussions with survivors. I hope to some day pass down my own story and learnings to help other women in similar situations. You will be contributing to me  as well as the circle and betterment of women everywhere. My mission is to not only heal myself and continue helping others as I've done my whole life  but also be a part of a growing movement dedicated to medical innovation through nature  studies on the emotional and environmental effects of our health  and most importantly  the possibility of miracles. Many of you already wrap me up in your friendship  comfort  and thoughts. For this  I am eternally grateful. And if you decide to share your resources to help me  please know I will be forever touched by your generosity  love  and willingness to walk with me through this journey. Thank you. With love  Nicole

As most of you know  my Dad suffered a severe car accident just over three years ago up in Minnesota and has been paralyzed below his neck ever since. Since that time  we've been through a lot. A lot of tears  frustration  agony  and hope that Dad will get back to living a normal life someday. Most days  Dad is confined to his wheelchair and/or his bed  which is all in the same living room of his home. Someone has to move him back and forth every day  feed him  change his clothes  etc. So  while living a normal life again doesn't seem possible at the moment  we are striving for him to at least gain as much of his body as he can  or at least see if it's a possibility. Dad has health insurance  which will pay for physical therapy for him to work on his arm/leg movement. However  he can't get back to physical therapy until doctors say he is making enough improvement with his current treatment  which is not covered by health insurance. He's been doing a program called ABLE  Activity-Based Locomotor Exercise program for the past couple months and they say he's really gaining a lot strength. They basically say we need to keep going with the program for 3 more months and see if he can improve enough to get put back into physical therapy - basically go big or go home for 3 months and see what happens. He has run through a lot of money/assets and is asking for help. I sometimes don't like gofundme pages  because I feel like a lot of them could be avoided if they simply had insurance in place. However  there are times for them and I believe this is one of them. His next 3 months will help determine a lot for the rest of his life and I'd like to help as much as I can. The cost of the ABLE program for this next time is going to be $4 600. If you feel like you're in a position to help even a little  he would really appreciate it. If not  please send positive energy his way if you don't mind...he needs everything at this point. Thanks so much!!

Soliciting donations to avoid medical debt-related bankruptcy sounds a lot like the fake letters to nudie magazines: “I never thought this would happen to me  but…” Similarly  every story results in the protagonist getting screwed.My wife is more than my better half: she has helped students inside prison find their own light and showed them the possibilities they retain in those oppressive environments to effect change. She brought my child into this world with just a half-cell’s contribution from me  struggling as her body dealt with an alien invasion that turned into the delightful child we plaster all over your screens.And her brain is a little bit broken. A frequent sufferer of migraines that required dozens of Botox injections prior to the pregnancy  my Nellky has cerebral blood flow a little bit different from you and I. We found out just how different a week ago.The first emergency room visit was for a classic migraine. For her  those mean four rounds of opiates to reduce the massive pain and give the brain enough space to try and resolve itself. It got worse just three days later.Nell complained of a thunderclap headache that was nothing like her nearly decade-long migraine history. The ER doc thought stroke. The tele-neurologist thought stroke. With varying degrees of sensation throughout her extremities  we were on board. They just couldn’t confirm it without an MRI scan. At a regional healthcare facility  that would take until morning. We got to the ER at 8 PM. You can only detect a mild stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA) within two hours of the event.Things went from bad to worse. Her pain wasn’t managed. She wasn’t seen by doctors for hours at a time. We had to fight with the medical director who threatened to kick us out of the hospital because we were pleading with him to find some way to manage her pain. It had been 36 hours at a 10 out of 10 scale. Unable to see  she nevertheless found a cousin at a hospital an hour away who fast-tracked her through their ER.The treatment plan there was simple: quiet  pain meds  peace. Nell and I both slept for the first time in 36 hours. It had been just five days since this ordeal started. There was  and is  just one issue: ongoing condition management.We moved down south from our home in New Jersey a few weeks ago. We’re 100 percent sure that the stress of that and our limited finances (we’re both at least two months behind on credit cards and old utilities) led to this stroke. Unfortunately  we also hadn’t had a chance to update our health insurance. Who does? Within a week of moving in with a two-year-old kiddo and a 14-year-old dog?So  three emergency room bills we haven’t seen yet. They usually cost a bit under $2 000. Two months of back bills at about $4 000. So  ideally we could raise $6 000-$10 000 and feel slightly less like bankruptcy is our best bet. Right now  we're shooting for less than half of that because we know that everyone is facing their own struggles. Christmas is coming  but it feels more like the chained ghost of Scrooge. I don’t even wear hats anymore  but I have a hat in my hand. If money is the root of most stress  it’s easy to see why we’re looking for some friends here. It’s the only way I know to keep my wife as healthy as she can be. Any bit you can manage would help.

On March 7th  I recieved a call at work that my fiance Jhovany had suffered a stroke.  He is only 25 years old and it was caused by high blood pressure. He was transferred to St.Luke's where he is currently sadated and in stable condition.  The stroke was on the right side of his body  and while the exact affects of the stroke are unknown to us as of now  he will no doubt need rehabilitation in the future. Thankfully he has health insurance  but there are costs that will arise on the long road to recovery.I have been with Jhovany for over ten years and he is the most loving  caring  hard working man that I know. Everything he has ever done has been to support me and now it's my turn to help him. His entire family and friends are by his side and I know that he is fighting his hardest.Any amount donated will be greatly appreciated as Jhovany was our main source of income. Any funds will go straight towards his recovery. Even if you are unable to donate  sharing or leaving a supportive message will be appreciated as well. Thank you so much.

Hello  Morgan is one of my 9 grandchildren. She is a 12-year-old little girl  smart  loving  funny  a great child all around.  On November 20  2018  Morgan and her Mom (Nicole LeClaire Gilbert) & Dad (Damion Gilbert) will be traveling to Boston where she will undergo surgery for a congenital abnormality in a chamber of her heart. It is a high-risk procedure and quite rare. Although her family has health insurance  the co-pay cost for this type of surgery is extremely high. In addition  she will need to remain at the Boston Children's Hospital for 10-14 days after the procedure to be sure the heart surgery was a success. Then  if all is good with her progress they will send her home for another 2-3 weeks of in-house recovery. The cost per night at a hotel/s close to the hospital is crazy  so any monies received will also assist with this expenditure plus travel/food etc.  her Mom and Dad will remain with her until she is released from the hospital.So I am asking all my family  friends  co-workers  fellow musicians  veterans to reach into your pocket and help her and the family with expenses that will be incurred during this extremely stress filled period.Thank You Gene Gilbert...Morgan's Papa

On November 16th  Paul was taken by ambulance to the ER with severe chest pain.  After several hours of tests and an angiogram  doctors found a 95% blockage of Paul’s left anterior descending artery and that he had suffered a mild heart attack. After two unsuccessful attempts were made to put in a cardiac stent  a third attempt was successful. Paul is now back at home recovering. We’re putting together this fundraiser to help with Paul’s medical bills  cardiac rehab  work wages  and unknown expenses he and his family face in the coming months. Paul is a very independent individual; he’s also loving  generous and hardworking. He never feels comfortable asking for help  but of all the circumstances in which people seek support  we feel live-saving heart surgery warrants it. We are not yet sure of all the medical expenses incurred but it will most likely cost several thousand dollars out of pocket even with health insurance.Any amount you can give is deeply appreciated. Feel free to share this page. Prayers for Paul’s recovery and for his family are very much appreciated.Thank you  sweet friends and family!

Dear family  friends  and whomever else may come across our story... We are Laurel and Peter Cabrera and for the past year our world  in some ways  was turned upside down as we grappled with the idea of being infertile. In a lot of ways this word does not feel right for us  two healthy individuals with all the right ingredients  yet the reality of naturally getting pregnant the old fashioned way is not in the cards for us. IVF for pregnancy is our only hope!Let us explain.... After moving to Oregon in late 2015 to be closer to family and settle our roots on the West coast  we knew it was finally the right time to really try to get pregnant. We assumed early on that it wasn't happening quickly do to the busyness of life and being in a transitional phase. But after a year or so had gone by with Laurel having regular health visits  acupuncture  and screenings that deemed everything healthy we knew something else was off. Our diligence in trying began to take its emotional toll  and it was time that Peter was screened to see if there were any contributing factors. And this is when the story shifts. Right before Christmas last year we got the news that there was NO sperm and we were in shock. This is not the outcome that we were prepared for! Seeing as these were rare results and did not make sense  we knew it was time to get serious and to consult a fertility professional. This is when he informed us that Peter needed genetic testing and that it was possible he was born without the vas deferens which carries out the sperm. Through genetic testing we found out more shocking news that Peter is a carrier for Cystic Fibrosis which is a direct link to being born without the vas deferens. We made an appointment with a specialty Urologist to confirm all of the results and our path was forever changed due to this news. IVF would be our only option of pregnancy now  but we would have to wait until September of 2018 for Peter’s TESE procedure to confirm that there was sperm and we are so thankful that there is!!During this time Laurel also got genetic testing to make sure she is not a carrier for Cystic Fibrosis and thankfully is not. It takes two carriers to have a child with the condition  and although that was a shocking discovery we are grateful that we can pursue having children knowing we won’t pass it on. All of this news was extremely heavy to take on. We had to mourn the fact that we will never be able to have a child the traditional way  and that our only means for pregnancy is medically intense and expensive. We bought our first home in 2017 dreaming about starting our family there  but never imagining the even bigger financial burden that we would have to take on. While grief has made its way in our journey we are also extremely grateful to be healthy individuals that have confirmation now  right before celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversary in October  that we can pursue IVF with hopefully great results. Our hope now is that the financial burden of it all could be lessened and we are also hopeful and grateful for any support that may come our way. Your love and generosity mean more than you can imagine. And we will take all the prayers we can get as we continue on this journey of starting our family.The Cost:Appointments  tests  and consultations are very expensive and not covered at all by health insurance! We are currently $3 000 deep for genetic testing  misc. appointments  and TESE procedure.IVF = $15 000This includes all appointments  medication/injections  and egg retrieval.:::We are very humbled to be in this position and to ask for help. While we stayed pretty private about this journey this year  it is our hope that sharing with loved ones will bring encouragement and that we may be surrounded in prayer. God has taken us on quite the journey this year  and we will continue to lean into Him and persevere as we prepare for IVF in late November. We appreciate your sensitivity in reading this and give many thanks in advance for your prayers and support!Love The Cabrera's

storyTitle: Bianca & Her Kidneys Need Our Help!
story: Hello lovely people! My dear friend Bianca Gaspar is facing a hugely difficult health challenge at the moment. She was recently diagnosed with Stage 4 Kidney Disease. Unfortunately  her health insurance isn’t covering the cost for a biopsy to understand where her treatment can begin  let alone her treatment costs. Now that Bianca has received support to afford her biopsy thanks to you all  let's support her so that when her treatment plan is determined next week she will be able to move forward with her doctor's recommendations. Bianca is one of the strongest  most giving people I know. She loves deeply and without fear and deserves the same in return from her community  in the form of us supporting her health and her ability to pursue her dreams.She is the most loving aunt to her niece and nephew and a complete joy to all of her family and friends  the sweetest dog mommy  and an overall amazing  fun-loving person. She has been dealing with debilitating fatigue in recent months due to her diagnosis and hasn’t felt like herself. She is headed back to school in January to continue on her journey to become a Child Psychologist. Please support her in her healing journey  so that she can focus on being the student  daughter  sister  friend  partner  and loving healer she is dedicated to be. Bianca’s father passed away from the same disease Bianca is currently facing when she was 16. The doctors at the time said it was most likely not genetic  so Bianca’s recent diagnosis came as a huge surprise. Bianca braved the loss of her father  among other hardships  with strength and resilience  just as she is facing her current circumstances. Now that she has her diagnosis  she is dedicated to facing whatever results she is given and to move forward with treatments that will allow her to live fully.Once a diagnosis is determined  treatment can help slow the progression of kidney disease and when necessary  kidney transplants are available. Thanks to you all  Bianca has her biopsy scheduled for the upcoming week! Through this  her underlying cause will be understood and her doctors will be able to determine her treatment plan as soon as possible. Bianca is attempting to enroll in a health insurance plan outside of her Indian Health Service plan so that her treatment plan will be covered. Bianca deserves to be able to get more than just her biopsy  so let's support her in receiving whatever treatment is recommended for her. There are many costs facing her in this journey and this campaign won't cover all of them but let's help her get started. Please help Bianca as she faces something that no 26-year-old should have to face. Let’s help her focus on continuing to learn and grow and brighten the world with her cheerful demeanor  her unsurpassed humor and her genuine love and connection with her loved ones. Let’s support Bianca’s kidney health so she can focus on life and her dreams!!

My twin sister  Andrea  was diagnosed with Stage 2 Cervical Cancer. Her type of cancer is considered a rare and aggressive form  so her team of doctors immediately started her on a simultaneous treatment of chemotherapy & radiation for the next 8-12 weeks or more. This is a very harsh treatment as she will be getting a few rounds of 2 different types of chemotherapy. It will be a long road ahead of healing and recovery. She has already begun feeling chemo fatigue  weight loss  hair loss  and intense mix of emotions. Andrea is hopeful though! She has faith in her doctors and in her conventional therapy  but she also knows that complementary alternative therapies are instrumental in the healing process. Therefore  she is now seeking natural  alternative modalities such as body work (massage)  regular acupuncture treatments  much needed herbs/supplements and guidance from a Certified Naturopathic Doctor that will complement her conventional cancer treatment in a safe & knowledgeable way. Alternative therapies can help Andrea feel more at ease  relieve her symptoms from chemo and radiation and give her the healing she deserves. Unfortunately  obtaining this complementary  alternative therapy is not cheap and is not covered by her health insurance.She was working full time  but is now on disability indefinitely until she gets better. As we all know  state disability is barely enough to pay for her food  gas  bills and home. Please help me raise funds to help Andrea obtain the alternative healing she needs to get through this. My sister is a beautiful  fun  happy and kind person who has always helped many before herself. It’s her time to receive all the love at this time. I will post updates as often as possible. I am happy to answer any questions about her journey  treatments and use of funds. Thank you for reading! Any amount is appreciated! My family & I are grateful to you all!

storyTitle: Please Help Me Save My Daughter
story: The opioid epidemic in this country is out of control.  You hear it in the news  but when it doesn’t affect you personally  you tend to ignore it and think it only affects the homeless or indigent. Heroin is used as a recreational drug today like marijuana was used in the 1970’s.  The big difference is that Heroin is one of the most addictive drugs out there.  Just a couple of uses and you are craving more. Opioids change the brains chemistry.  Once you start to take opiates  your brain wants to repeat those feelings of calmness  pleasure and excitement and that’s how addiction gets started. The rehab and detox centers around this country  especially the government subsidized ones  tend to operate like prison release programs and do not provide a healthy environment for those in need of detox  rehab and recovery.  In fact  their recovery record is sadly only around 3%. The truth is you can detox your body within 7-10 days  but the withdrawal symptoms are so severe  most can’t handle the suffering and run out to get the next fix to relieve the symptoms.  Symptoms include nausea  vomiting  cramps  severe joint aches  cold sweats  shivering and extreme anxiety. Detox is only the first step.  Mental recovery is the next phase and that typically takes from 60-120 days of intense therapy  life skill training  and positive social interaction to reintegrate the patient back into a normal life  free of drugs  but also with the mental skills to successfully overcome depression and be a productive and happy person again. The expense for this type of detox and recovery is beyond most peoples reach.  Typical detox runs around $5 000  but the 2-4 month recovery is the most expensive.  The most successful recovery clinics are clinics that house the patients for up to 4 months and involve them in positive activities along with regular therapy sessions  physical exercise and life skill training.  Costs for these types of rehab facilities run from $40k to $60k for in-house residency.   That’s why I’m requesting your help today.  My beautiful daughter met the wrong guy and made the choice to join him in his drug dependency.  He has not only provided the drugs  but he has physically abused her and stolen all of her valuables to finance his own dependency. I have successfully relocated her away from this toxic environment and placed her in a medical detox program  but the next step will be an expensive recovery period.  Unfortunately  health insurance pays little  if any  towards this type of treatment.  I’m asking for your help by making a contribution to my ‘Go Fund Me’ page to help cover the extreme costs.  Any amount will help and be greatly appreciated.  Thank you so much for your compassion and understanding.

It was on a Sunday the 24rth early evening I was on my way to my work site  where I musically perform  as I was leaving my vehicle in the parking structure I walked about 10 yards or so when I blacked out for a moment things got bright I lost site but stood still never falling holding on to my equipment cart  then I gradually came to  meet y whole body felt heavy but I still was standing  when I gained conscious I started walking towards the lobby found the first chair and sat for a minute  then I continued towards the stage and rested there for another few minutes and had set my equipment up and performed with no problems. After my gig was over I was rapping things up with difficult in breathing  so I took my time in doing so. Anyway I made it back to my car and got home safely my average drive time from work to home is about an hour. I told my wife of the incident and went to the ER they did tests when they did an EKG they said there was an abnormal reading of my heart they further tested and said I had an heart attack I told them there was no chest pain what so ever. I gotten medi-vac two days later to Oahu admitted into Kaiser Moanalua where I’m waiting for a triple bypass. Doctors doing extensive testing and found three main arteries are shutting down. They told me of my options  one was to take medications to sustain the problem  the other is to go through with the operation with a chance of having a heart attack during surgery. It’s Saturday the 28th of March and I’m still waiting for the doctors decision they mentioned my chances are slim. On top of all of this  I am a dialysis patient which limits my ability to provide for my family  however  my wife who works full-time is now on FMLA (With No Pay) and we’re both out of work for time being. We’re just like any working family with income coming in  but now life has thrown us a curve ball and we’re trying to pay what ever bills we can  with whatever savings we have left.  We’re not sure how much all these surgery  medications  hospital stay & service will cost us  yes I’m covered under my wife health insurance but we have co-pay and other service cost to cover .. My wife puts on a brave face & pretend she’s okay  but I can see she’s worried  & she’s hurting .. she’s the foundation of Our Family she keeps us together & keep us strong.

Kelly was recently diagnosed with stage 3 rectal cancer. Though she does have health insurance  the medical costs are still unbearable. She is currently undergoing chemotherapy. After chemo  she will have to undergo radiation (with more chemo)  and hopefully at the end of it all she will have surgery (most likely more than one). Each time she goes into her appointments she has co pays and her insurance does not cover all the scans  labs  and office visits entirely. Sadly the bills are coming in fast and they are more than the average person is able to keep up with. There is enough stress that comes with a cancer diagnosis that a person should not also have to worry about all of these medical bills as well. She is still trying to work full time while going through treatment but any help will be greatly appreciated. We will keep you updated on her prognosis as we know more and go through this journey with her. We want to say thank you in advance for any type of donation and all of the well wishes.

On October 27  2018  our lives were forever changed. Our father was diagnosed with lung cancer. It started with some back pain that eventually worsened and lead to the doctor who suggested he get an MRI on his back and neck. The results came back and it showed a mass next to his spine on the nerve sheath about 2x1.5cm in size. We did not know at that time if it was cancerous or not. Dad went to a few doctors but ended up back in the emergency room every week. Finally  the last visit on October 27  they did a full MRI and CT scan and that is when they found the mass on his lung  in his liver  and tumors all down his spine. We are devastated. We are at an absolute loss for words but we are hopeful. We are strong because he is strong.      Dad has worked in masonry his whole life  since he was a child  no joke. He has done brick  block  stone  tile  concrete  shotcrete  you name it and he has done it and not only has he done it but he is damn good at it and the best that I have ever seen. He is not one who pains easily. He is the toughest and strongest man I know so when he told us and we saw how much pain he was in  we didn't take it lightly. Dad has worked his rear off his entire life to keep a roof over our heads  food in our bellies  and clothes on our backs. He has given his last dollar to someone in more need of it than him. He would give you the coat and shirt off of his back during a blizzard  because that is my father. He taught us to care for others  nature  and most importantly family and ourselves. This man isn't just our father  he is our best friend and that is why we need your help so badly.      We have an appointment with the oncologist Thursday  November 1  for a consultation. I am hoping they will be able to do something quickly about the tumor that is pressing against his spine which is causing him the most pain. He cannot use his right arm much at this point and has been without sleep for weeks. He is able to sleep but its only for a few hours here and there on and off. We know he is going to need surgery and probably chemo or radiation  we are not 100% positive at what all we are looking at until we do the consult Thursday. But  what we do know  is he is already drowning in debt because of this. Dad was in the middle of getting his company started and up off the ground so he is in between health insurance right now. He is already over $5 000 in debt just from the MRI's and emergency room visits  not to mention the orthopedic surgeon they sent him to before they knew what the situation was and the other doctors he has visited in-between. We need all the help we can get to help him stay as stress free as possible during this whole situation. If we cannot get health insurance for him or financial assistance  because they are very limited in funding  we are terrified that he will be so stressed from the amount of debt that he puts himself into that he won't have the spirit to stay positive and keep a positive outlook which could diminish his outlook on the whole situation. I know he would never give up  that is not in his soul. But  there is only so much one man can take. Please  share this  donate  spread the word. This man has given people a place to call home when they had no home of their own. He has given people food to eat when they had nothing to eat or anyway of paying for food. He is not a saint  believe me  but he is the greatest man I have ever met and he is our best friend and our father. We cannot let him leave this Earth before he sees his grand-babies grow up. We thank you from the very depths of our hearts. We are staying positive and hopeful and expect him to pull through this but we can't do it alone.

Dear Friends  Family  and Community:Today is my birthday  and in celebration  I am making the biggest and hardest ask of my life. I have spent many years helping others  happily committed to my role as a therapist  volunteer  nonprofit worker  and slightly codependent lover & friend  Now  however  I am in a position where I need to put myself front and center and ask for your monetary support.  For those of you who don’t know  I’ve been diagnosed with a recurrence of ovarian cancer  only seven years after my first surgical treatment to remove an ovary. I dream of living a long and healthy life  preserving the vitality of my precious body and remaining ovary  and maybe having a child one day. In an effort to give myself the best chance possible at a happy and healthy future  I’m pursuing both alternative and conventional treatments. Most of these (primarily alternative) are  unfortunately  not covered by health insurance and I do not have the financial resources to pay for them out of pocket. These include ozone therapy  IV therapy  hyperbaric oxygen chamber and infrared saunas  colonics  nutritional supplements and vitamins  hormone and blood testing  psychological therapies  energy healing  and the list goes on. In total  approximately one month of treatment alone costs $5 000. Additionally  standard tests like a PET scan have been rejected by insurance  and if I pursue surgery  it will personally cost me $7 500. I understand there may be deep fears  concerns  and skepticism around the effectiveness of some of my treatments and medical choices. Please trust that I have made these decisions only after extensive research and many inspirational discussions with survivors. I hope to some day pass down my own story and learnings to help other women in similar situations. You will be contributing to me  as well as the circle and betterment of women everywhere. My mission is to not only heal myself and continue helping others as I've done my whole life  but also be a part of a growing movement dedicated to medical innovation through nature  studies on the emotional and environmental effects of our health  and most importantly  the possibility of miracles. Many of you already wrap me up in your friendship  comfort  and thoughts. For this  I am eternally grateful. And if you decide to share your resources to help me  please know I will be forever touched by your generosity  love  and willingness to walk with me through this journey. Thank you. With love  Nicole

As most of you know  my Dad suffered a severe car accident just over three years ago up in Minnesota and has been paralyzed below his neck ever since. Since that time  we've been through a lot. A lot of tears  frustration  agony  and hope that Dad will get back to living a normal life someday. Most days  Dad is confined to his wheelchair and/or his bed  which is all in the same living room of his home. Someone has to move him back and forth every day  feed him  change his clothes  etc. So  while living a normal life again doesn't seem possible at the moment  we are striving for him to at least gain as much of his body as he can  or at least see if it's a possibility. Dad has health insurance  which will pay for physical therapy for him to work on his arm/leg movement. However  he can't get back to physical therapy until doctors say he is making enough improvement with his current treatment  which is not covered by health insurance. He's been doing a program called ABLE  Activity-Based Locomotor Exercise program for the past couple months and they say he's really gaining a lot strength. They basically say we need to keep going with the program for 3 more months and see if he can improve enough to get put back into physical therapy - basically go big or go home for 3 months and see what happens. He has run through a lot of money/assets and is asking for help. I sometimes don't like gofundme pages  because I feel like a lot of them could be avoided if they simply had insurance in place. However  there are times for them and I believe this is one of them. His next 3 months will help determine a lot for the rest of his life and I'd like to help as much as I can. The cost of the ABLE program for this next time is going to be $4 600. If you feel like you're in a position to help even a little  he would really appreciate it. If not  please send positive energy his way if you don't mind...he needs everything at this point. Thanks so much!!

Soliciting donations to avoid medical debt-related bankruptcy sounds a lot like the fake letters to nudie magazines: “I never thought this would happen to me  but…” Similarly  every story results in the protagonist getting screwed.My wife is more than my better half: she has helped students inside prison find their own light and showed them the possibilities they retain in those oppressive environments to effect change. She brought my child into this world with just a half-cell’s contribution from me  struggling as her body dealt with an alien invasion that turned into the delightful child we plaster all over your screens.And her brain is a little bit broken. A frequent sufferer of migraines that required dozens of Botox injections prior to the pregnancy  my Nellky has cerebral blood flow a little bit different from you and I. We found out just how different a week ago.The first emergency room visit was for a classic migraine. For her  those mean four rounds of opiates to reduce the massive pain and give the brain enough space to try and resolve itself. It got worse just three days later.Nell complained of a thunderclap headache that was nothing like her nearly decade-long migraine history. The ER doc thought stroke. The tele-neurologist thought stroke. With varying degrees of sensation throughout her extremities  we were on board. They just couldn’t confirm it without an MRI scan. At a regional healthcare facility  that would take until morning. We got to the ER at 8 PM. You can only detect a mild stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA) within two hours of the event.Things went from bad to worse. Her pain wasn’t managed. She wasn’t seen by doctors for hours at a time. We had to fight with the medical director who threatened to kick us out of the hospital because we were pleading with him to find some way to manage her pain. It had been 36 hours at a 10 out of 10 scale. Unable to see  she nevertheless found a cousin at a hospital an hour away who fast-tracked her through their ER.The treatment plan there was simple: quiet  pain meds  peace. Nell and I both slept for the first time in 36 hours. It had been just five days since this ordeal started. There was  and is  just one issue: ongoing condition management.We moved down south from our home in New Jersey a few weeks ago. We’re 100 percent sure that the stress of that and our limited finances (we’re both at least two months behind on credit cards and old utilities) led to this stroke. Unfortunately  we also hadn’t had a chance to update our health insurance. Who does? Within a week of moving in with a two-year-old kiddo and a 14-year-old dog?So  three emergency room bills we haven’t seen yet. They usually cost a bit under $2 000. Two months of back bills at about $4 000. So  ideally we could raise $6 000-$10 000 and feel slightly less like bankruptcy is our best bet. Right now  we're shooting for less than half of that because we know that everyone is facing their own struggles. Christmas is coming  but it feels more like the chained ghost of Scrooge. I don’t even wear hats anymore  but I have a hat in my hand. If money is the root of most stress  it’s easy to see why we’re looking for some friends here. It’s the only way I know to keep my wife as healthy as she can be. Any bit you can manage would help.

If you know Heather  chances are you’ve already been touched by her kindness. You may be a child or parent at Schuylerville Elementary where Heather donates her time  a Veteran suffering from PTSD receiving free Meditation classes  a mom needing an assist or a friend in need of the uplifting support that only she can give.  What you may not know  is that while Heather has been giving to us over the years  behind the scenes she has experience devastating blows to her health. Fourteen years ago Heather was diagnosed with a type of Ulcerative Colitis that was atypical and unexpected. It had already advanced and spread to the entire colon. She did not respond to typical medical intervention which resulted in adverse reactions to medications  closer monitoring and an inability to control her painful symptoms. What followed was a host of other autoimmune diseases that she’d have to fight against including a rare incurable disease of the liver that increases her risk of terminal cancer  liver transplant  and shortened life expectancy  a devastating blow while she was preparing for emergency surgery to remove her diseased colon. The last two years have been filled with countless trips to the ER  ambulance rides to Albany Med and St. Peters  and being informed twice by Drs. that had she had waited any longer she would have died. Septic Shock the first time  and more recently  a post surgical complication causing her intestines to twist and seal themselves. By the time they operated her abdominal cavity was filled with blood  stool and a life threatening infection.If you know Heather  you know she is more comfortable with giving help than receiving.  After much encouragement  we helped her to see there are a group of people that want to help. I have no doubt she is already contemplating ways to pay this forward.  So here we are  on Heathers behalf  reaching out for your help.  If you would like to donate to someone that truly works hard to help herself  this is it.  If you are looking to help a person that is truly selfless  this is it.  If you want to help support a single mother of three that really IS that amazing mother you see on Facebook?? THIS IS IT! Here’s what she needsHeather needs to heal; her disease is aggravated by stress which further reduces her immune system. If we could raise enough to help cover the bills that go well beyond what she receives in child support  she can rest easy and give her body the time it needs to heal. Expenses include heat  electricity  car insurance  trash pickup  sewer and water  health Insurance for her and three kids  medical supplies  prescriptions  endless co-pays and a growing tally of out of pocket medical expenses.Heather has big plans for the future  but the one that keeps her from giving in to this disease is to be well enough to raise her children the way she always has  and if we can give her the ability to help those kids become even half the person she is  we have made a difference.  Heathers parents  siblings and her “Tribe”  thank you for your support.With Love Team Heather

Randy Stewart (our brother)  has been able to get his life back on track over the past several years after suffering through some very difficult periods of hardship. Just when things were going well for him  he has taken a step back  as he was recently diagnosed with kidney and lung cancer.   Randy has been fortunate to have a job that provides him the benefit of health insurance; however  that will not come close to paying his medical bills and living expenses.   We are reaching out to family and friends in  hopes of helping him to be able to focus on getting well--and not on worrying about how he is going to continue to pay for his treatment or monthly bills.   Your donations will go a long way to helping us reach that goal.  Thank you  in advance  for your generous support.

Hello everyone  thank you for taking the time to click on this. I've put off making this post for as long as I could  hoping things would get better  but unfortunately they have not.As most of you are aware  the last few months have not been kind. Back in November of 2018 I wound up needing an emergency MRI to determine whether I was at risk of a stroke or brain bleed  following a severe trauma to my neck that left me in profound and debilitating pain for several weeks  on top of my other chronic long term conditions and disabilities. It was extremely scary and worrying  but thankfully I had a good support base  and look good in scrubs.Fortunately the scan came back in the clear  and the pain and other symptoms were attributed to a severe muscle tear that spanned from the base of my skull  all the way around the entire right side of my head. I am now 9ish weeks into the estimated 12 week healing process and doing well  and while we are truly grateful my brain was okay  unfortunately our finances have taken a major hit as a result of the MRI  as it was also during this emergency visit to the hospital that we found out our health insurance had wrongly dropped me due to a change in my immigration status  meaning I was completely without coverage without any idea of having been dropped.  We contacted our insurance provider (Blue Cross) immediately about this and were told they would look into it  but nothing has come of it and I have been left to pay the MRI bill. The initial cost of the MRI was estimated to be $2-3k  but following some complications and needing a more complex scan  the bill wound up at $5 731.33. This does not include the cost of pain management or physical rehab.As you can see  the hospital has already removed $2 636.41 from this total  (though an additional $800 was tacked on from a separate radiology department where my results were sent to for processing) leaving us with a bill of roughly $3 094.92 which we could have managed in monthly installments...if my partner  known affectionately to most of you as ETD and on occasion \Mothman\" hadn't been told he needed wisdom tooth surgery as a matter of some urgency or risk major infection.We took out a loan to cover the cost of his surgery and he's scheduled to go in for the procedure this month  and while we could have managed to juggle things for a bit  we also found out at Christmas that my mother has cancer  and I will likely need to fly home to the UK (on my own) pretty soon to try and help deal with that. Even still we had hoped to muddle through for a while  but as of today February 4th 2019  my desktop computer has died  taking with it my ability to work. It's my sole source of income and needless to say I'm lost without it. Worse yet Patreon announced this last week that they are suffering from delayed payment processing again  meaning I will not get paid in time  and the month of February and beyond has finally gotten too much for us and we need help.I know times are hard for everyone  and I always hoped I would never have to do this again  but anything you could do to help would be greatly appreciated.  In reality we need somewhere around $4-5k  but I am hoping to get just enough to take my monthly bills to the hospital down to a manageable amount. Doing so would allow us to pay it off gradually over time  and afford us time to breathe.If we somehow manage to meet and go over the target goal  all extra funds will go toward clearing off the medical debt in full  and also possibly PC repairs to get me back to work asap. Thank you for your support and kind words over these last few months  it means the world to both of us and we're beyond humbled that you allow us to be part of your lives. Take care  and thank you again. With all our love and gratitude Joy & ETD."

Our dear friend Leah Gold has breast cancer and she's about to start a 5 month long treatment  which means she will only be working very limited hours when possible. She has some health insurance to help her  but she needs help paying the rent and bills while she is busy kicking cancers ass. Leah is an amazing Seattle filmmaker (currently making a film about the band Negativeland)  an incredible Archie McPhee employee  a totally fun weirdo and super positive force in the Northwest scene. Can you spare a few bucks to help her beat Cancer?

Dear friends  family  and loved ones As most of you know  in October of 2016  our Uncle Brendon was diagnosed with appendiceal cancer. Fortunately  the doctors caught it in time and were able to perform a successful surgery. Fast forward to the fall of 2018  Brendon was feeling discomfort and went in for scans. He soon learned the cancer was back  only this time it was significantly more aggressive. The doctors informed Brendon that he needed surgery and chemotherapy treatment immediately  and they agreed to move forward. Unknown to Brendon at the time  his health insurance had been revoked. On November 1st  the doctors performed a nine-hour surgery and a chemo wash. They were able to remove multiple tumors. However  due to the location of the tumors  they had to cut his femoral nerve  which caused him to lose mobility in his right leg. A day before being discharged from the hospital  Brendon learned his lymph nodes had tested positive for cancer. He was later diagnosed with stage four. He has since been in and out of the hospital for numerous procedures  and he recently started a rigorous chemo treatment that will last six months. Brendon has devoted his entire life to his family  farming  and ranching. He has two little boys and another baby due in February. He is an incredible father  son  partner  brother  friend  and uncle. He farms and ranches in Medicine Lodge  Kansas  but the cancer has prevented Brendon from working for the past four months. Uncle Brendon has always been there for us without expecting anything in return. He is first in line to help when crisis strikes. He is the strongest person we know  and it is our turn to be strong for him. Please help us support Uncle Brendon kick cancers ass.Thank you for your support.

Help Cindy Fight CancerOur mom  Cindy Kluver  was diagnosed with breast cancer on January 24  2019. In early February  she underwent surgery to remove the lump and recently started radiation. Unfortunately  her health insurance coverage is limited and her out-of-pocket medical expenses are already mounting.  It has been a difficult journey for our family watching her go through this awful diagnosis. She has been the mainstay of our family and family business for as long as we can remember.  The growing medical bills are affecting our small family business and Cindy's mental health. We want to help our mom beat this and have started this Go Fund Me account to ease the burden on her if we can. Our mom is a very private person and  if you know her personally  you will know how hard it is for her to open up about her challenges with this battle. Any amount donated will be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your love and support!  Thank You Julian  Zach  and Devon Kluver

In 2015 I suddenly noticed that my vision was not as good as it had been. I worked evening shift as a Respiratory Therapist in a busy trauma center in Charleston  SC and realized that driving home in the dark was suddenly difficult. I had trouble seeing the monitors and reading charts.  A visit to my Ophthalmologist  determined that I have Retinitis Pigmentosis  a degenerative retinal disease that is causing me to lose my peripheral vision  the ability to see at night and eventually render me blind. I was caught off guard by this diagnosis and to learn there is no cure. This is an inherited disease and my then 12 year old daughter was diagnosed with a form of it as well. In 2016 I had to leave the career I loved because I could no longer drive at night and provide life saving treatments on critically ill patients. Glasses and traditional treatments will not help this condition. If left untreated I will eventually lose most if not all of my vision. I have lost much of my peripheral vision already and can not manage in the dark without assistance. My right eye has almost lost all central vision and what remains is cloudy.There is an ongoing clinical study being conducted that will accept me as a patient but the treatments are not covered by my health insurance. The out of pocket costs for this stem cell treatment amounts to almost $20 000 for both eyes. Additionally there is the cost of staying in Florida for a week and time off of work for me and my husband  Lee. The ongoing results of patients with this treatment show much improved vision over a 6 month period after treatment and the vision remains stable.  Any help provided to me will not only improve my vision   but make this treatment available to my daughter in future years and will also provide awareness of this debilitating disease.Please consider helping me reach this goal by making even a small donation and sharing my story through your social media accounts. “For I know the plans I have for you \ declares the Lord  \"plans to prosper you and not to harm you  plans to give you a hope and a future.\" Jeremiah 29:11Tammy Jackson"

My mom  Patricia  is 54 years young and resides in Ellsworth Michigan.She is a proud first time Grandma to a baby girl about to celebrate her 1st birthday. Patricia is a Navy veteran who until recently was working as a nurse at a long term care facility taking care of others. Most people who know my mom know that she is a kind  loving \mama bear\" who enjoys helping others. She has opened her home to those in need and has always given what she could to assist others. Now she needs your help.On October 15th 2018 my mom was diagnosed with stage 3 invasive ductal carcinoma  3B with lymph node involvement. Due to the advanced state of her breast cancer the doctors have told us that she needs to start treatment immediately. Doctors have recommended a treatment plan of 1 year chemotherapy along with surgery to remove all tissue affected.  Unfortunately because of all the medical appointments not allowing her to maintain her work hours  on October 23rd she went to work for the last time at the job she loves. She no longer has medical insurance because she was forced to leave her job and is not currently eligible for Medicaid because she \"made too much money\" in the last 30 days. She was supposed to start her chemotherapy today  November 2nd  but because her insurance coverage ended at the end of October her treatment has been \"delayed\".  Although we have found a medical insurance solution  it will not begin until December 1st 2018. My mom needs life saving treatment as soon as possible! We are asking for donations to help cover the cost of Patricia's new health insurance that has a very high monthly premium and deductible. Also  some of the diagnostic tests to include a 3D mammogram along with full body scans were \"approved\" by her previous insurance but the costs are not fully being covered. Patricia has already incurred some medical debt and her treatment hasn't even begun! Although she hopes to return to work helping others again  right now she is unable to earn an income and is relying on the generosity of family and friends to get her through this difficult time. I pray that my daughter will grow up making memories with her amazing  strong  beautiful and very proud grandmother. Any and every bit of help towards Patricia's breast cancer battle will be forever appreciated. Thank you!"

Our dear friend Matt Gullett is one of the most honorable people we know.  Among some other very dedicated and hardworking people who stay up all night tuning skis in the Vail Valley  he's the guy who runs the big MontanaTM ski tuning machine for one of the biggest ski tune shops in the valley  and has for the past 13 years.Unfortunately  Matt encountered a major health setback  got stuck back home unable to work after a hospital stay  and he needs all the help he can get with medical bills.  He has touched many lives in an indirect way tuning skis  and hopefully many will touch him back.These guys are top notch people and ski technicians who do it all and who work all night  until all of the skis and boards are finished and ready for fun on the mountains.  They tune equipment from all over the world  so please share this request with all of the kind people you know  especially to anyone you know who may have been our guests here in Colorado’s Vail Valley.If you came to the Vail Valley in the last 13 years and strapped boards to your feet  Matt probably had something to do with it.  Many local businesses farm out their tuning work to his shop  and our friend is big part of the reason why.Think about how valuable Matt is in our community  since many of us love to slide down snow covered mountains  as do a lot of our guests.  ;)  The ski and snowboard industry rides on the backs of dedicated people like Matt Gullett  and unfortunately  health insurance is out of reach for many of them.Please share this with all of the ski and snowboard enthusiasts you know...all over the world.  Let's give people a chance to thank a tuner with a \tip\".  Fellow tuners and happy ski bums may want to share a bit too  if they can.Our friend Matt would NEVER ask for help  so that's why we are doing it for him.  He's a really good human with a kind soul  and he really needs all the help we can share with him.Please help if you can.  Absolutely anything you send will be very much appreciated.  He's very careful with his money.  ;)  Let's just say he's thrifty.Matt has been saving everything he can to have knee surgery performed on his best friend's knee.  She's pictured with him  and her name is Prudi.  They have been separated since Matt got sick  and they are both pretty sad about it.  Prudi is just a delightful furball of energy and a very sweet dog.  Thanks to good folks  she is on her way home to help Matt heal.Please share this request with as many good people as you can.  There are so many people who can relate to his story.  Often it seems like the people who have less to give  give more.  Knowing how hard it is makes good folks want to help.  Thank you for that. It will be nice to hear from other countries  especially if his shop tuned their \"owned\" or \"rented gear\".  There are a lot of animal lovers who may be able to share a few bucks  so please share this with them too.  It's going to be a long road for Matt. Thank you so very much from all of us for any help you can share with Matt and Prudi."

14-godišnja hrvatska djevojka s rijetkim stanjem dobiva šansu u Americi  ali joj treba pomoć 14-godišnja Vanesa Dolenec iz Koprivnice u sjevernoj Hrvatskoj rođena je rijetkom i složenom anomalijom klače. Rođena je bez jednog bubrega  mjehura  debelog crijeva i kirurški je uklonjen maternicu. Svakog drugog dana odlazi na liječenje u zagrebačkom Rebro bolnici i za nju ima normalni život zahtijeva operaciju mokraćnog mjehura i transplantaciju bubrega. Osim što je hrvatski predsjednik upoznat sa svojim slučajem  Vanesa je konačno dobila priliku i bila je prihvaćena 26. prosinca u Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center.Niz operacija očekuje Vanesa u Americi  kao što je povećanje mjehura  kateterizacija  a ovisno o njezinom stanju nakon toga presađivanje bubrega. Svi troškovi bolnice  kako objašnjava njezina majka Kruna  pokrivat će Hrvatski zavod za zdravstveno osiguranje (HZZO)  ali to samo izdvaja dio problema obitelji Dolenec.\Trebam prikupiti novac za zrakoplovne karte  vizu i smještaj jer moramo platiti sve to. Prema dogovoru s liječnicima  Vanesa mora biti tamo (u Americi) do kraja svibnja sljedeće godine jer je to vrlo dug proces i morat će u bolnicu svaka tri tjedna. U međuvremenu moramo ostati negdje  moramo jesti i to je sve velika cijena  pogotovo za nas  budući da smo potrošili našu posljednju kunu na liječenje za našu kćer \"  rekao je Kruna. Kruna je pružila niz različitih udruga  ali bez sreće. Obitelj se približava svima koji se nalaze u Cincinnatiju u blizini bolnice  koji bi mogli pomoći kod smještaja. Ako možete pomoći na bilo koji način s smještajem  molimo Vas da kontaktirate Ivu Funtek na e-mail: ivafuntek33@gmail.comHere is the story in English14-year-old Croatian girl with rare condition gets chance in America but needs help14-year-old Vanesa Dolenec from Koprivnica in northern Croatia was born with a rare and complex cloacal anomaly. She was born without one kidney  a bladder  colon and has had her uterus surgically removed.  Every second day she goes for treatment at Zagreb’s Rebro hospital and for her to have a normal life she requires bladder surgery and a kidney transplant. Apart the Croatian president became familiar with her case  Vanesa was finally given an opportunity and has been accepted at the Cincinnati Children’s Hospital Medical Center on 26 November. A series of operations await Vanesa in America  such as bladder enlargement  catheterization  and depending on her condition after that  a kidney transplant. All the hospital expenses  as her mother Kruna explains  will be covered by The Croatian Health Insurance Fund (HZZO)  but this only sorts out part of the problem for the Dolenec family.“I need to raise money for airline tickets  visas and accommodation because we have to pay for this all ourselves. According to the agreement with the doctors  Vanesa must be there (in America) until the end of May next year because it is a very long process and she would need to go into the hospital every three weeks. In the meantime we need to stay somewhere  we have to eat and this is all a big cost  especially for us as we have spent our last kuna on treatment for our daughter ” Kruna said. Kruna has reached out to a number of different associations but with no luck. The family is reaching out to anyone in the Cincinnati area near the hospital who could possibly help with accommodation. If you can help in any way with accommodation please contact Iva Funtek on email: Ivafuntek33@gmail.comYou can also make donations to help the family on the GoFundMe page which has been set up on the link below: Help Vanesa GoFundMe"

As some of you know and as most of you don’t  I almost lost my husband on the first day of 2019.Anthony called me into our room later in the evening on the first and told me he couldn’t breathe. Thankfully his mom was there as well so she called 911 while I kept talking to Anthony and was trying to keep him conscious. The EMTs and firefighters were there within just a few minutes and took Anthony to the hospital. They told me I couldn’t ride with them. I wasn’t thrilled but thinking back it was probably for the best. At some point on the way to the hospital  Anthony went into cardiac arrest and flatlined. They were able to bring him back but he flatlined again as soon as he got into the ER. I am beyond grateful they were able to bring him back both times.It certainly hasn’t been an easy road for any of us. Anthony was intubated for close to 5 days in the ICU. It turns out he had massive blood clots in each lung. This caused the breathing issues  stress to his heart  and is ultimately what led to the cardiac arrest. Those first few days were rough. The thought that he might not make it through is more terrifying than I can ever explain. But with everything going on  I didn’t let those doubts and fears consume me.There are a million thank yous to give out. Thank you to both mine and Anthony’s friends and family who were there for us. Whether you were there physically or over the phone  it was so comforting to know that we had people there for us. Thank you to all the amazing doctors  nurses  and therapists at Memorial and Brooks Rehab that took amazing care of him. Anthony would not be here without them and there are not enough thank yous in the world to express my appreciation to them. Thank you to our amazing job and coworkers. Our job has been so understanding and thoughtful during this time. And many of our coworkers donated PTO to ensure Anthony would continue to receive his full check as short-term disability only provides 60%.Unfortunately  during all that happened  Anthony lost his eyesight. If you know Anthony  then you know his passion for photography and his modeling agency. To see someone so full of life and passion go through what he’s gone through is heartbreaking. Without his eyesight  Anthony can’t do what he loves the most. That along with losing mobility and speech have been extremely hard on him. The amazing therapists at Brooks were able to help him with the mobility and speech issues and he’s nearly back to 100% in that area. His eyesight has come back some  but he can only see colors and shapes of people through his peripherals. This has been a very tough transition for him. He’s seen several specialists and will continue to see more until they can figure out why his vision is gone and what  if anything  they can do to restore it.While we do have great health insurance  there are still a lot of bills to pay. So far  Anthony has racked up over $480 000 in medical bills. We are only responsible for $4500 of that  thank goodness. That is still a lot to pay and more than we can afford to spare. We are trying to raise $3500 to help cover our part of the costs. Anything you can do to help is very much appreciated. We are not normally ones to ask for help but at a time like this it’s needed. Our families have been so wonderful and giving during this time but we don’t want to continue to rely on them as they have their own responsibilities to take care of.Thank you for taking the time to read all of this. If you can’t donate  we completely understand. Believe me. But we ask that you do share this and help us meet our goal.With much love  Anthony and Hallah.

storyTitle: Gift of Time//Cherish Every Moment with Kathleen
story: In May of 2009  my mother  Kathleen Nash Donlan  was diagnosed with lung cancer. Since that day  Kathleen has relentlessly battled cancer with every ounce of energy she has.  Her journey began with a right lung resection and postoperative recovery that gave her 24 months of health and happiness that she took full advantage of with her family and friends.  Unfortunately  this happy cancer free time didn’t last long and only marked the beginning of my mom’s 10-year battle against cancer.  The primary tumor had metastasized prior to her lung resection and my mom was diagnosed with brain cancer in July 2011.   She endured three different brain surgeries  a brain infection  countless rounds of localized radiation therapy and ultimately immunotherapy treatment with Avastin and Keytruda as a last attempt to control the relentless spread of cancer throughout her body.  Miraculously  my mother’s tumors responded to Keytruda  but complications resulting from the immune response led to lung toxicity and intracranial hemorrhage that has left my mom on oxygen  non-ambulatory and unable to care for herself.I have been my mother’s primary caregiver since 2009 and together we have battled this disease with love  laughter  tears  perseverance and unbreakable wills that won’t ever give up.  There have been many highs along the way but each low is now getting more challenging for us to manage and we know that the gift of time can only last so long and we need to cherish every moment we have together.  Making this trying time even more difficult is that our health insurance and a hospice care agency has failed to provide the ongoing support  treatment and care that my mom requires. This disappointing and stressful situation has forced me to use personal savings to provide private care that my mom requires.  My mom is a fighter even in her 18-month hospice journey and we are thankful for every minute we have with her  but the long fight has depleted our resources.  The support from our GoFundMe will go directly to providing 24 hour home health aides  certified nursing assistants  medications  medical supplies  and therapists to manage painful symptoms of spasticity  rigidity and ongoing health challenges related to Metastatic Cancer  Advanced COPD  and complications from an Intracranial Stroke.  Any support you can provide will be a great help and deeply appreciated.  Also  if you could please forward and share Kathleen's story with friends and family in your network we would be forever grateful.A HEARTFELT THANK YOU to each and every one of you for taking the time to read and share Kathleen's cancer journey. As with all cancer cases  this has been a battle  we are so grateful for all the wonderful support Mom has received over the years from our community of family  friends  and clinicians during her decade of treatments. The journey has not been an easy one but we continue to cherish each day as a gift and every day we are reminded of how fragile our lives can be. ❤️ Xo

storyTitle: Help Anna Say Bye to Cancer for Good #forrubykae
