story: Hello family and friends  I am starting this campaign for my sister  Murl Parker.  In September 2018   my sister had a mastectomy due to an aggressive form of breast cancer.  We were hopeful  as the surgery was a success and she was on the mend.  Unfortunately  Murl was recently informed there is a lump in her other breast that will require surgery as well.  This has been a blow to us all.My sister is a hard working and devoted Christian woman who has helped so many.  Being out of work without pay and having a health insurance plan that only paid a small portion of the doctor and hospital bills  she has been left in a precarious situation where financially things are a struggle.  Murl has sought financial assistance through other resources and programs  but regrettably she has been denied.  As a result  she is understandably stressed and overwhelmed with bills in addition to preparing for an approaching surgery. I love my sister very much and this is why I am asking for your support. I am asking for your help with assisting her to pay for the growing amount of medical bills - any donations large or small would be greatly appreciated.   I recognize money is tight for many people these days  but if you have the ability to bless her with any amount  it would help. Funds will be directly applied to my sister’s bills and any other unexpected costs that will inevitably arise as a result of her surgery and associated treatments.  Thank you and may God continue to bless you.Bettie Goganious

storyTitle: Dwayne Johnson - massive stroke family needs help
story: My husband  Dwayne Johnson is 37 (his 38th bday is 3/29) and he is an amazing father  husband  brother  son  and uncle.  People just gravitate to him because of what a people person he is and  just over all a great person.  He loves camping and taking his children on adventures to the boerne cibolo or down the walking trail.  Dwayne was offered an amazing job opportunity that was in the workings and prior to him being able to start work ...on March 23  2019 at around 8 am he had a massive stroke caused by 2 blood clots on his brain. Thanks to Boerne EMS they were at our house in lightening speed and rushed him to University hospital in San Antonio which undoubtedly saved his life.  Because he was in between jobs he did not have health insurance and because I need to be by his side I am on medical leave from work which now takes our monthly income to just about 0.  Not only do we need to pay for his medical bills but we also have bills that dont stop and we are so overwhelmed with what the near future holds for us.  My kids don’t understand why their mommy and daddy isn’t at home and I feel so split because I cannot leave the love of my life’s side but I also miss my babies so much. We hate asking for help but with all the chaos I don’t want my children to have to lose their home or have to be burdened by this struggle. We KNOW God will heal and we KNOW God provides and we have complete faith we will get through this  we just need a little help doing so.  If you can’t help financially  prayers are very much needed and appreciated. We we love you all and I will keep this updated. It may be every few days as I am so overwhelmed but together with God we can do it. This too shall pass.

My mother  Janet Richman  was recently diagnosed with breast cancer.  I'm extremely concerned because she does NOT have health insurance coverage  like millions of other Americans.  She has been told that she makes too much money for Medicaid  based on her paycheck and Social Security  but she cannot afford a recent huge increase in the cost of Obamacare. I'm trying to raise enough money to fund her monthly insurance payments and deductibles so she can get good medical care until she reaches age 65 and starts on Medicare.  I hope you will contribute. Whether you are in a position to contribute or not  would you please pass this message along to 5 people  or put it on your Facebook page  and help me get some help for my Mom?  Any funds that are not needed will be contributed to the American Cancer Society in memory of my sister Aja  who was also stricken and succumbed to cancer. Thanks in advance  Sam Richman

Please help Eric and his family! Eric is the most amazing handyman with incredible work ethics and loves his clients and what he does.  A few weeks ago Eric fell ill with an acute intestinal infection. Thinking a round of antibiotics would cure it  he anticipated being back to work shortly.  The infection spread and is showing no sign of being under control. He requires surgery to correct the damage but it can't be done until the infection is under control. He is on a 24 hour IV antibiotic drip and unable to work. Eric is self employed without backup funds to care for his family; a lovely wife and four beautiful children. Eric was a young  energetic  hardworking guy now faced without the financial resources to survive a life threatening event like this. His medical bills are mounting daily and he has limited health insurance.Any and all donations will help enable Eric to pay for the growing medical bills to help fight the infection and subsequent surgery and take care of his family until he is healthy enough to work again.

Brenda is a tireless community organizer in Los Angeles. She spends her time building bridges between dozens of organizations  connecting the dots in the progressive movement and creating solidarity with her efforts. She is also the founder of the #MeToo Survivors' March  which has been a major resource for survivors of sexual assault and domestic violence.She recently found a lump in her right breast  and after several tests and biopsies the results came back positive for cancer cells. She had a lumpectomy and has started a daily 6 week long radiation process. Through this all she continues to organize and advocate for the people  but she has unfortunately fallen through the gaps of our failing healthcare system in this country.Brenda lost her health insurance two years ago and has been struggling to get coverage ever since. As a diabetic  this has really affected her. Before the recent cancer diagnosis Brenda’s medications already cost $700 a month  too many times she could not afford this and was left to pick and choose which medications she needed most and could actually obtain. If there were ever a campaign worthy of your support  it is this one. As Brenda's friends know  she never asks for help for anything and spends her life giving to others. Now is the time for us to return that love and kindness  and support this wonderful human being in her time of need.  Please dig deep and give whatever you can to help  it couldn't be going to a better person. <3

Melissa and I have been friends since we first met at work in Florida in 1991. Although we have recently been physically living far away from each other  we still remain close friends and anyone who knows “sweet Melissa” knows that she is a beautiful person inside and out who has survived several hardships and worries about everything and everyone else.Melissa is now faced with the fight of her life - Triple Negative breast cancer. Thankfully it has not metastasized and she is beginning her treatment next week. Due to the nature of her cancer  there are no targeted therapies or chemo therapies that have been “proven” in this type of cancer. The treatment she has chosen is considered to be “experimental” and therefore  much of it will not be covered via health insurance. She likely will be missing work on top of the medical expenses. She does have some family support thankfully but they don’t have all of the funds required to pay out of pocket  either. This year  as I turn 50  I don’t want any gifts. I need nothing  I want nothing  I am blessed beyond belief with family and friends. Your gift to me would be to donate to my GoFundMe for my dear friend Melissa so she has some less worry and can concentrate on her treatment and healing.If you cannot donate  I ask that you please share. Thank you!Cheryl

storyTitle: Shannon's Tumor Surgery Medical Expense Fund
story: Hello friends. I write this to you all today with a heavy but hopeful heart.  If you're fortunate enough to know our beautiful friend and Nashville's most dynamic diva  Miss Shannon \Million\" McCarthy then you know what it means to have a genuine  REAL friend who's always there for her friends through thick and thin  good times and bad. Well now Shannon needs OUR help. On Wednesday March 27th  2019  Shannon underwent a surgery that may have potentially life changing consequences.  After multiple MRI's and scans  Doctors discovered multiple fist-sized tumors in her abdomen area that are pressing on her other organs and have been causing her to have dizzy and fainting spells.  As for the level of risk these tumors pose to her overall health  it is unkown at this time.  The scary part of this is her Dr's will not be able to actually diagnose her medical status until the tumors have been fully biopsied in the lab.  This will mean many more tests to come.  Beyond the scans  anesthesia and the actual surgery  Shannon is facing countless medical bills from every facet of this daunting procedure. So I've created this GoFundMe to help her with the sizable medical debt that is coming (as sure as the sun rises and sets). Fortunately she does have health insurance  but like so many of us  it's a high deductible policy (very high) that still has quite a ways to go to be met and she has thrown all her savings into it. So friends  if you're one of the many hundreds (probably even thousands) of people whose life Shannon has touched with her fantastic love  light and energy  please help us to help her get her through this frightening event so she doesn't need to worry about money and can focus on her full recovery.   Thank you and God Bless  Mahalo One Love.  -Dan\"Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.\" ~Marcel Proust"

storyTitle: Jeff Krause-Get His Feet Running Again
story: On November 17  Jeff and his daughter  Brooke were in a car accident. The car was totaled and  while both of them were very lucky  they both received significant injuries that will impact them for quite a while. While I could spend a lot of time to recount the possible impacts of the injuries to Jeff  who’s life’s work involves using his hands and Brooke  who is a gymnast  I’d rather focus on Jeff and the amazing things that he’s done. Jeff is a passionate person who gives 110% to everything that he does. A drummer in our worship band  a cheerleader for the Good Shepherd World Vision fundraising team  a member of the 80s band AHPP  through which he has helped raise thousands of dollars for other charities  he is generous beyond measure. He’s also a Dad  son  brother and friend.   He’s a volunteer teacher of drum classes at the church. I’ve know him about 10 years and believe he would literally give you the shirt off his back  even if it was the only shirt he owned.  Jeff  through his own admission  doesn’t have much. He’s had some tough breaks BUT  that being said  he would give you everything he had if it would put the littlest bit of joy in your heart. He recognizes that his joy comes from the Lord (and his daughter Brooke) and nowhere else.  https://www.facebook.com/GoodShepherdMadisonVerona/videos/2133226313389481/ There are some pretty significant expenses associated with his accident. He doesn’t have car or health insurance and is going to need to take some time off of work to recover. His only car and method of transport is now totaled. His expenses will be significant  but with any luck (and God’s Grace)  he’ll move forward  once healthy  without a lot of additional debt baggage. I have learned that a little bit from a lot of people can make a huge difference so please give what you can. You have no idea the impact you can make through your generosity. If you have nothing to give financially  your prayers are also appreciated. Thank you!Jeff’s Angels

On Thursday March 7th Travis collapsed at work from a severe case of kidney stones. Unfortunately he has not been with this job long enough to have health insurance. We are raising emergency funds to cover his prescriptions  post-surgery care  and living expenses until he can get back to work.BackgroundAfter collapsing from pain last Thursday Travis was taken to a hospital that was said to have a urologist on staff but instead wasn’t seen until Saturday when he was diagnosed with kidney stones in his urethra.The hospital did not have access to the machine that could blast the stones so instead they did surgery to put a tube in his kidney and sent him home on Monday. We are now waiting for the hospital to alert us that the machine is available.The medications needed for pain management and preventing infection will cost thousands. We expect follow-up visits (which aren’t considered life threatening) to require immediate payment. We are asking your financial help to pay for prescriptions  medical visits post-surgery  and rent and other basic living expenses through the healing period.

￼Please join us in helping a family member in need.  Matt is one of those amazing people who will do anything for others  every time  all of the time.  He is one of the most selfless people on the planet.  On Saturday  Matt suffered a major stroke that has left him currently in ICU with a long road ahead of him for recovery.  Thankfully he and his wife  Tracey  have health insurance to help cover most of their medical needs  but there will be deductibles  co-pays and such. He will need to use short-term and long-term disability insurance which will leave a large deficit in their household expenses.  Neither of these people would ask for help  but would give the shirts off of their backs to help others. We are asking for your help.  Your generosity will go towards making sure they get through this time without having to struggle financially  as they will already have to focus on a long and tough recovery.  Matt is a tough man and will work very hard to achieve his goals.  We ask for your prayers  thoughts and financial help.  Please take a moment to give and  while giving  say a prayer for a quick and complete recovery.  We love you both very much Matt and Tracey!

A little bit of history back in 2002 at the age of 16  Marquis was diagnosed with lupus  high blood pressure  and renal (kidney) failure. He did dialysis for about 3 years and miraculously his kidneys regained function. Fast forward to December 2013 his luck ran dry  but no need to get sad he got a refill. Marquis had to restart dialysis and has been doing it for the last five years. Once Marquis obtained the proper health insurance  he decided to try to get on the transplant list. On October 1st he started the process to get his name on the list  and on October 30 he completed the process and was told he will receive a letter to let him know if he was approved. On November 3rd  he got a call that he was a backup to a potential donor and the next morning got the call that the kidney would be going to him. With that being said  the surgery was a success and he is now in the recovery process.  Recovery starts as a three month journey that requires him to be out of work. It also requires him to have a caregiver 24/7 for those three months  which would be me  his wife. The process was so quick it didn’t allow us enough time to financially prepare to be out of work for 3 months. Even the nurses called it a miracle for the timeframe. We also have a son who is in his senior year of high school who is getting excited for College next fall.Furthermore  in order for the new kidney to work there are immuno-suppressant drugs that Marquis needs to take for the rest of his life.  Although insurance covers majority of the medications there are a few that are still quite pricey. Also  with both of us being out of work for 3 months at such short notice we need assistance with bills and our sons senior class fees. Marquis had this to say; I come to you all today as a humbled man. With me being out of work for three months (maybe more) and my wife being out of work for three months we’re going to need for you all to find it in your hearts to be a blessing to the Murdaugh family. Please don’t think any amount is too small “little by little a little becomes a lot”Please keep Marquis and our family in your thoughts and prayers. We appreciate any help we can get  thank you!

storyTitle: I need your help!    Preciso da sua ajuda!
story: Olá  eu sou a Ana Consuelo  nesses últimos 6 meses venho tendo um declínio de saúde. Fui a vários médicos e não descobriram o que era. No mês de dezembro fui parar na emergência. Fui internada imediatamente e fizeram uma cirurgia pra remoção de um tumor no cólon do útero. Nos próximos dias vou dar início à quimioterapia mesmo não tendo seguro de saúde. Não tenho família aqui e por isso venho pedir encarecidamente a ajuda dos meus amigos e clientes. Não posso trabalhar por ordem médica e não tenho condições físicas. O tratamento inicial dura por 7 meses. Preciso muito de ajuda financeira  principalmente nesta fase. Ficaria muito grata por sua generosidade e compaixão. Deus abençoe sua vida.Hi  I'm Ana Consuelo  in the last 6 months my healthy has been declining. I went to several doctors and did not find out what it was. In December I went to the emergency room. I was hospitalized immediately and had surgery to remove a tumor in the colon of the uterus. In the next few days I will start chemotherapy even without health insurance. I do not have family here and so I come to ask for the help of my friends and clients. I can not work by medical order and I have no physical conditions. The initial treatment lasts for 7 months. I need a lot of financial help  especially at this stage. I would be grateful for your generosity and compassion. God bless your life.Hola  yo soy Ana Consuelo  en estos últimos 6 meses vengo teniendo un declive de salud. Fui a varios médicos y nadie descubrio lo que era. En el mes de diciembre fue a la emergencia. Inmediatamente hicieran una cirugía para retirar un tumor en el colon del útero. En los próximos días voy a iniciar la quimioterapia aunque no tenga seguro de salud. No tengo familia aquí y por eso vengo a pedir encarecidamente la ayuda de mis amigos y clientes. No puedo trabajar por orden médico y no tengo condiciones físicas. El tratamiento inicial dura por 7 meses. Necesito ayuda financiera  sobre todo en esta fase. Me quedaría muy agradecida por su generosidad y compasión. Dios bendiga su vida.

storyTitle: Elga Lyle's battle with stage 4 Colon Cancer
story: Elga Lyle continues to battle Stage 4 Colon Cancer.  She's had 2 very aggressive Chemo treatments  with at least 4 more to go.  It's taking a toll on her body.  She can't teach her regular Pilates and kickboxing classes  and she has a $10 000 deductible on her health insurance plan.        We  the Cancer Terminators  are committed to raising enough money to help pay her health insurance deductible  and help with her other medical and living expenses.         This is round #2 for Elga Lyle and cancer. She beat non-Hodgkin's lymphoma 15 years ago  now it's round 2 with colon cancer. Elga is a fearless and determined cancer survivor.  She's a warrior when it comes to fighting cancer.  She is the inspiration for our team  \The Cancer Terminators\".   She's an accomplished Pilates and kick-boxing instructor for over 10 years  so she knows how to fight.  We're gonna terminate colon cancer."

On July 24th  2017  my boyfriend James  had a seizure for the first time in his life. He never had a history of medical issues in the past. He was rushed to the nearest hospital and after several tests  doctors discovered an AVM (Arteriovenous Malformation). AVM is an abnormal connection between arteries and veins  usually in the brain or spine. AVM is very rare in which there are fewer than 200 000 US cases per year. Fortunately  due to the seizure  we were able to discover this AVM before it ruptured. The neurosurgeon advised that he undergoes surgery as soon as possible due to the size of his AVM (see photo 1). You can see that there is a large black area to the right of the brain scan  which shows his veins being \clogged\". Unluckily  James did not have health insurance at this time because he got a new job and his company insurance would not activate until the following December. On August 2nd  2017  James underwent a 9-hour brain surgery. Thankfully  his surgery was a success. And while he was discharged after about a week in the ICU  he was continuously accumulating medical bills/costs day by day. After 3 months of being seizure free  James started getting seizures again and was admitted to the ER several times. After each visit  his neurologist kept increasing his dosage on both his medications (Keppra and Vimpat). He is now at maximum dosage.Although James is currently doing well  he is overwhelmed with medical bills with a minimum balance of $400 per bill. After each visit to the specialist and the ER  he has over 15 bills to pay off in conjunction with other household and student bills. While we are doing everything we can  due to the high minimum balances  the bills have now been sent to the collections agency. We ask for your help. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Please keep James in your prayers during this recovery process."

storyTitle: Help Alan Pay For Thyroid Surgery
story: I was recently diagnosed with thyroid cancer  and had surgery. Even though I have health insurance  the out of pocket costs and costs of being out of work are still very high. I am grateful to all the friends and family who have offered love and encouragement along the way. Thanks for reading this.

storyTitle: Help the Horger Family Fight Cancer
story: Many of you may not know me but my name is Katherine. I have been employed  as a groomer  by Bella's Grooming for the past 2 years. Richard & Christina are my bosses but they have become sincere friends that I care deeply about. We have all spent a lot of time together both at work and outside of it and I have gotten to know them well.If you don't know their story  Richard & Christina moved from NY to VA in March 2015. They opened their shop in April 2015 and have been serving the community for almost 4 years. They built their business from the ground up  often working long days. I've seen them come in early  stay late and even work on their days off. Richard has been grooming for close to 18 years and I have learned so much from him in my time here. He will always stop what he's doing to both show and explain things to me. Christina does a lot of things here but primarily does \front of the house.\" She usually always deals with the customers. I have found her to be friendly & personable. We could be having an insane day and she always takes a moment to converse with every person that calls or stops by. After years of hard work  they were finally able to purchase their first home in May 2018.If you do not know  this family has fallen on tough times recently. In August 2018  their son Hadrian aka Georgie was diagnosed with Level 2 Autism. In December 2018  Richard was diagnosed with advance stage lymphoma. During the month of December  Richard did not have health insurance. In December  he had 2 hospital stays  2 surgeries  an MRI  CT Scan  multiple prescriptions and started chemotherapy...all without health coverage. Though Rich is \"lucky\" to have health coverage for 2019  the treatments he is undergoing are considered somewhat \"experimental\". Their insurance company continues to fight them tooth & nail on most claims they receive. Aside from medical bills  they  like all of us  have day to day expenses  household expenses  etc. They are commuting to both Farmville & Lynchburg daily for treatments. I think that Richard & Christina are the backbone of America. They are small business owners that live and work in the community they serve. They employ local people (me) and help keep money in Charlotte County. They have worked too hard to have everything they've achieved be taken away by the ugly disease that is cancer. Since they are self-employed  they don't get the luxuries that some of us may take for granted including sick time  medical leave  holiday pay  etc. If they're not working  they're not making money. Dedicating time to work can be difficult while dealing with an intensive treatment regimen & daily commutes.I wanted to start this fundraiser as a way to help some folks I care about. We have watched each other's kids grow. Georgie was only 4 months old when I started here  now hes over 2 years! They were there for me at the hospital when I had my daughter. They were also at my wedding in August 2018. I'm asking everyone  if you can help in some way  please do so. Even the smallest donation will make a difference to this family."

No one wants to hear the news that they have cancer. It never comes at the \right\" time or under the \"right\" circumstances. That being said  I can think of few worse times to hear those awful words  than when your wife is 8 months pregnant with your first child and you've just begun to start your young family. That is what my brother and his wife heard last Friday when they were informed that he has a Choroidal Melanoma in his left eye. This is considered to be an aggressive cancer although thankfully it has been caught in stage 1. Quickly removing the cancer can result in a good long term outcome. Unfortunately the nearest treatment center for this type of cancer is in NYC  therefore my brother and his wife face travel expenses they hadn't anticipated  along with the potential cost of non-covered treatments. Due to longstanding financial hardship  my brother has gone without health insurance since the age of 18 until recently at the age of 35. Thankfully  he finally has insurance and was able to catch the cancer before it became terminal. He needs urgent treatment  which most likely necessitates the removal of his left eye due to the size of the tumor and proximity to the optic nerve  because this cancer can rapidly become fatal. With the costs of starting a new family especially with a little girl on her way he's now left wondering how to cover the added expenses suddenly thrust upon him. I hope this GoFundMe campaign will help make this painful process a little less burdensome and ease some of the stress on his mind as he faces the removal of his eye and an uncertain future as a cancer victim. Every little bit helps especially everyone's thoughts and prayers.Please help us spread the word and share this with your friends <3"

storyTitle: Melissa Bishop Fight Against Stage IV lung cancer
story: On November 11  2018 Melissa received the phone call confirming our worst fear  she has stage IV lung cancer.    If you've ever met Melissa you know how amazing she is.  Her life has always been dedicated to others.  Anyone who has been touched by her can tell you story upon story of her kindness.   Melissa has been SO reluctant to allow this GoFundMe because she STILL feels like others need help more than she does.  The bottom line is her medical expenses are in excess of  $1000 a month out of pocket per month.  Her insurance deductible is $6600.  She obviously can't work.  Her amazing husband Larry is self-employed.   He doesn't get paid time off to care for her.  This is our opportunity to give back  she needs us.  This is Melissa's story in her own words: *****************************************************************\About 7 years ago I got a very bad case of the flu. It affected my breathing my oxygen level and had me in bed for around 6 weeks. I developed pneumonia from it and saw a noticeable marked difference before and after the flu with my breathing. With no Health Insurance I did what many Moms do…put ourselves on the least priority list. I honestly thought I would just get better. My Dr. thought I had some damage to my lungs due to the pneumonia but it was manageable. I had a chronic cough but it really did not impact nor affect my daily life. I was told I had mild asthma and allergies which made sense. I used an inhaler when I had flare ups and everyone around me became numb to my cough. I am not a smoker nor ever have been. people who are smokers smoke outside when I am near by and my home is 100% smoke free. I cared for animals  lifted heavy bags of feed  exercised and despite coughing spells and frequent bronchitis I was impacted very minimally. It became my normal. In July during one of my coughing spells I started coughing up blood. Even us tried and true Martyr Moms know this is the time to get to a Dr. We recently acquired a high deductible Health Insurance policy so decided to use it. My Dr thought I had a sinus infection she decided to do a sinus ct scan and add on a chest ct in case. At the hospital the techs broke character and shockingly asked me if I worked at an asbestos factory. I knew the scan was abnormal but was not ready to hear that I had Chronic Interstitial Lung Disease with Pulmonary Fibrosis. My Pulmonary Dr. assured me while it is labeled as incurable many treatments including lung transplant can greatly increase quality of life and life span. We were devastated to hear this. 5 years? How is this possible for a nonsmoking very active female? This is something 90-year-old men get after heavy smoking for years  right? Upon further scans Dr's became concerned with a dark mass on my lower left lung. Upon several attempts at biopsy and a very painful open lung biopsy  I was told that the tumor is Non-small cell adenocarcinoma lung cancer.  A further Pet Scan found another active spot on my upper right lobe that is the same cancer type. Apparently  the bad condition of my lungs makes my cells reproduce as cancer cells instead of healthy cells. At my most recent visit Hopkins Dr's told me that due to my Lung Disease they cannot aggressively treat the cancer and due to the cancer  they cannot properly treat my Lung disease. They labeled me as incurable and said on average people in my situation live about 1 year. They are offering Chemotherapy to see if they can slow the progression of cancer growth and prolong my life. My first treatment was on November 28th. Thus far my body is handling the chemo well. I have faith and hope. I am also trying Chinese medicine and some alternative therapies. Now adding insult to injury when people like myself hear devastating news like this  many things happen. You see the sadness and horror in your friends and family’s eyes. You realize that all your plans for Grandkids  growing old with your kids and spouse and friends are all in jeopardy. You watch as income dwindles and expenses rise and see the immense impact your illness has on those you love. Agencies that are supposed to be your safety net treat you like you are trying to pull one over on them. So instead of enjoying every minute with your family you are visiting lawyers  getting loans on your house and signing papers to try to extend your life. It is devastating. My goal in life is and has always been to help others. My prayer is that if even 1 person goes to see their Dr for an annoying cough and gets early treatment and saves them and their families from going through what we are then it will be worth being open about our current struggles."

My oldest brother had a stroke 10 days ago and he is only 40 years old. He has a 2.5 year old son that he loves dearly. He works at Home Depot but is now disabled and does not have health insurance. Please help out in whatever way you can. Thank you so much.

My mother  Janet Richman  was recently diagnosed with breast cancer.  I'm extremely concerned because she does NOT have health insurance coverage  like millions of other Americans.  She has been told that she makes too much money for Medicaid  based on her paycheck and Social Security  but she cannot afford a recent huge increase in the cost of Obamacare. I'm trying to raise enough money to fund her monthly insurance payments and deductibles so she can get good medical care until she reaches age 65 and starts on Medicare.  I hope you will contribute. Whether you are in a position to contribute or not  would you please pass this message along to 5 people  or put it on your Facebook page  and help me get some help for my Mom?  Any funds that are not needed will be contributed to the American Cancer Society in memory of my sister Aja  who was also stricken and succumbed to cancer. Thanks in advance  Sam Richman

Please help Eric and his family! Eric is the most amazing handyman with incredible work ethics and loves his clients and what he does.  A few weeks ago Eric fell ill with an acute intestinal infection. Thinking a round of antibiotics would cure it  he anticipated being back to work shortly.  The infection spread and is showing no sign of being under control. He requires surgery to correct the damage but it can't be done until the infection is under control. He is on a 24 hour IV antibiotic drip and unable to work. Eric is self employed without backup funds to care for his family; a lovely wife and four beautiful children. Eric was a young  energetic  hardworking guy now faced without the financial resources to survive a life threatening event like this. His medical bills are mounting daily and he has limited health insurance.Any and all donations will help enable Eric to pay for the growing medical bills to help fight the infection and subsequent surgery and take care of his family until he is healthy enough to work again.

Brenda is a tireless community organizer in Los Angeles. She spends her time building bridges between dozens of organizations  connecting the dots in the progressive movement and creating solidarity with her efforts. She is also the founder of the #MeToo Survivors' March  which has been a major resource for survivors of sexual assault and domestic violence.She recently found a lump in her right breast  and after several tests and biopsies the results came back positive for cancer cells. She had a lumpectomy and has started a daily 6 week long radiation process. Through this all she continues to organize and advocate for the people  but she has unfortunately fallen through the gaps of our failing healthcare system in this country.Brenda lost her health insurance two years ago and has been struggling to get coverage ever since. As a diabetic  this has really affected her. Before the recent cancer diagnosis Brenda’s medications already cost $700 a month  too many times she could not afford this and was left to pick and choose which medications she needed most and could actually obtain. If there were ever a campaign worthy of your support  it is this one. As Brenda's friends know  she never asks for help for anything and spends her life giving to others. Now is the time for us to return that love and kindness  and support this wonderful human being in her time of need.  Please dig deep and give whatever you can to help  it couldn't be going to a better person. <3

Melissa and I have been friends since we first met at work in Florida in 1991. Although we have recently been physically living far away from each other  we still remain close friends and anyone who knows “sweet Melissa” knows that she is a beautiful person inside and out who has survived several hardships and worries about everything and everyone else.Melissa is now faced with the fight of her life - Triple Negative breast cancer. Thankfully it has not metastasized and she is beginning her treatment next week. Due to the nature of her cancer  there are no targeted therapies or chemo therapies that have been “proven” in this type of cancer. The treatment she has chosen is considered to be “experimental” and therefore  much of it will not be covered via health insurance. She likely will be missing work on top of the medical expenses. She does have some family support thankfully but they don’t have all of the funds required to pay out of pocket  either. This year  as I turn 50  I don’t want any gifts. I need nothing  I want nothing  I am blessed beyond belief with family and friends. Your gift to me would be to donate to my GoFundMe for my dear friend Melissa so she has some less worry and can concentrate on her treatment and healing.If you cannot donate  I ask that you please share. Thank you!Cheryl

storyTitle: Shannon's Tumor Surgery Medical Expense Fund
story: Hello friends. I write this to you all today with a heavy but hopeful heart.  If you're fortunate enough to know our beautiful friend and Nashville's most dynamic diva  Miss Shannon \Million\" McCarthy then you know what it means to have a genuine  REAL friend who's always there for her friends through thick and thin  good times and bad. Well now Shannon needs OUR help. On Wednesday March 27th  2019  Shannon underwent a surgery that may have potentially life changing consequences.  After multiple MRI's and scans  Doctors discovered multiple fist-sized tumors in her abdomen area that are pressing on her other organs and have been causing her to have dizzy and fainting spells.  As for the level of risk these tumors pose to her overall health  it is unkown at this time.  The scary part of this is her Dr's will not be able to actually diagnose her medical status until the tumors have been fully biopsied in the lab.  This will mean many more tests to come.  Beyond the scans  anesthesia and the actual surgery  Shannon is facing countless medical bills from every facet of this daunting procedure. So I've created this GoFundMe to help her with the sizable medical debt that is coming (as sure as the sun rises and sets). Fortunately she does have health insurance  but like so many of us  it's a high deductible policy (very high) that still has quite a ways to go to be met and she has thrown all her savings into it. So friends  if you're one of the many hundreds (probably even thousands) of people whose life Shannon has touched with her fantastic love  light and energy  please help us to help her get her through this frightening event so she doesn't need to worry about money and can focus on her full recovery.   Thank you and God Bless  Mahalo One Love.  -Dan\"Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.\" ~Marcel Proust"

storyTitle: Jeff Krause-Get His Feet Running Again
story: On November 17  Jeff and his daughter  Brooke were in a car accident. The car was totaled and  while both of them were very lucky  they both received significant injuries that will impact them for quite a while. While I could spend a lot of time to recount the possible impacts of the injuries to Jeff  who’s life’s work involves using his hands and Brooke  who is a gymnast  I’d rather focus on Jeff and the amazing things that he’s done. Jeff is a passionate person who gives 110% to everything that he does. A drummer in our worship band  a cheerleader for the Good Shepherd World Vision fundraising team  a member of the 80s band AHPP  through which he has helped raise thousands of dollars for other charities  he is generous beyond measure. He’s also a Dad  son  brother and friend.   He’s a volunteer teacher of drum classes at the church. I’ve know him about 10 years and believe he would literally give you the shirt off his back  even if it was the only shirt he owned.  Jeff  through his own admission  doesn’t have much. He’s had some tough breaks BUT  that being said  he would give you everything he had if it would put the littlest bit of joy in your heart. He recognizes that his joy comes from the Lord (and his daughter Brooke) and nowhere else.  https://www.facebook.com/GoodShepherdMadisonVerona/videos/2133226313389481/ There are some pretty significant expenses associated with his accident. He doesn’t have car or health insurance and is going to need to take some time off of work to recover. His only car and method of transport is now totaled. His expenses will be significant  but with any luck (and God’s Grace)  he’ll move forward  once healthy  without a lot of additional debt baggage. I have learned that a little bit from a lot of people can make a huge difference so please give what you can. You have no idea the impact you can make through your generosity. If you have nothing to give financially  your prayers are also appreciated. Thank you!Jeff’s Angels

On Thursday March 7th Travis collapsed at work from a severe case of kidney stones. Unfortunately he has not been with this job long enough to have health insurance. We are raising emergency funds to cover his prescriptions  post-surgery care  and living expenses until he can get back to work.BackgroundAfter collapsing from pain last Thursday Travis was taken to a hospital that was said to have a urologist on staff but instead wasn’t seen until Saturday when he was diagnosed with kidney stones in his urethra.The hospital did not have access to the machine that could blast the stones so instead they did surgery to put a tube in his kidney and sent him home on Monday. We are now waiting for the hospital to alert us that the machine is available.The medications needed for pain management and preventing infection will cost thousands. We expect follow-up visits (which aren’t considered life threatening) to require immediate payment. We are asking your financial help to pay for prescriptions  medical visits post-surgery  and rent and other basic living expenses through the healing period.

￼Please join us in helping a family member in need.  Matt is one of those amazing people who will do anything for others  every time  all of the time.  He is one of the most selfless people on the planet.  On Saturday  Matt suffered a major stroke that has left him currently in ICU with a long road ahead of him for recovery.  Thankfully he and his wife  Tracey  have health insurance to help cover most of their medical needs  but there will be deductibles  co-pays and such. He will need to use short-term and long-term disability insurance which will leave a large deficit in their household expenses.  Neither of these people would ask for help  but would give the shirts off of their backs to help others. We are asking for your help.  Your generosity will go towards making sure they get through this time without having to struggle financially  as they will already have to focus on a long and tough recovery.  Matt is a tough man and will work very hard to achieve his goals.  We ask for your prayers  thoughts and financial help.  Please take a moment to give and  while giving  say a prayer for a quick and complete recovery.  We love you both very much Matt and Tracey!

A little bit of history back in 2002 at the age of 16  Marquis was diagnosed with lupus  high blood pressure  and renal (kidney) failure. He did dialysis for about 3 years and miraculously his kidneys regained function. Fast forward to December 2013 his luck ran dry  but no need to get sad he got a refill. Marquis had to restart dialysis and has been doing it for the last five years. Once Marquis obtained the proper health insurance  he decided to try to get on the transplant list. On October 1st he started the process to get his name on the list  and on October 30 he completed the process and was told he will receive a letter to let him know if he was approved. On November 3rd  he got a call that he was a backup to a potential donor and the next morning got the call that the kidney would be going to him. With that being said  the surgery was a success and he is now in the recovery process.  Recovery starts as a three month journey that requires him to be out of work. It also requires him to have a caregiver 24/7 for those three months  which would be me  his wife. The process was so quick it didn’t allow us enough time to financially prepare to be out of work for 3 months. Even the nurses called it a miracle for the timeframe. We also have a son who is in his senior year of high school who is getting excited for College next fall.Furthermore  in order for the new kidney to work there are immuno-suppressant drugs that Marquis needs to take for the rest of his life.  Although insurance covers majority of the medications there are a few that are still quite pricey. Also  with both of us being out of work for 3 months at such short notice we need assistance with bills and our sons senior class fees. Marquis had this to say; I come to you all today as a humbled man. With me being out of work for three months (maybe more) and my wife being out of work for three months we’re going to need for you all to find it in your hearts to be a blessing to the Murdaugh family. Please don’t think any amount is too small “little by little a little becomes a lot”Please keep Marquis and our family in your thoughts and prayers. We appreciate any help we can get  thank you!

O tratamento inicial dura por 7 meses. Preciso muito de ajuda financeira  principalmente nesta fase. Ficaria muito grata por sua generosidade e compaixão. I need a lot of financial help  especially at this stage. I would be grateful for your generosity and compassion. She beat non-Hodgkin's lymphoma 15 years ago  now it's round 2 with colon cancer. Elga is a fearless and determined cancer survivor.  She's a warrior when it comes to fighting cancer.  She is the inspiration for our team  \The Cancer Terminators\".   She's an accomplished Pilates and kick-boxing instructor for over 10 years  so she knows how to fight.  We're gonna terminate colon cancer."
